name: New Jersey State Museum
address: 205 W State St, Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews: The reason I love this place is because it was the place where Rare Disease Day 2020 was hosted and celebrated. Because of its ideal location in the heart of Trenton, the event was able to have its' very first legislative roundtable where 2 assemblymen and 2 assemblywomen were able to make there way over to the event and interact directly with attendees. The entrance is accessible and the event was held on a Monday morning and surprisingly allowed for easy street parking. The acoustics and lighting were a bit difficult. The windows allowed way too much light into the room where clear pictures were practically impossible to take. If the windows had drapes, it would have allowed for better picture taking but the in person experience was very much enjoyable.

This was well above my expectations. The museum is relatively small compared to some others, but the quality is on par with the really big museum. It is free to get in, free parking on the weekends and the staff there is truly exceptional. I took my kindergartner for the exhibits and Planetarium. She absolutely loved it. It was easily one of the best free activities to spend 4 hours with her.

It’s great for a free little museum. I enjoy taking my kids especially upstairs to see the natural science section and there are puzzles and books upstairs as well. Nice gift shop and we have enjoyed the planetarium a few times (not free). Parking is the only problem—if you park in the garage, be prepared to have to ask to be let back in as the door locks behind you. And the people are always grumpy to open it for you.

I love this museum! Its free and its a great place to go with kids or on your own. There's always something to learn! The staff is friendly and great with kids. Every exhibit is fascinating. The second floor has a kids area where they can learn through play. We haven't done a planetarium show yet but we hope to soon!

It's the kind of Museum you would expect from a small City. The exhibits were marginally interesting with the sole exception of the art gallery which had a wide array of interesting paintings ranging from the 19th century to contemporary art. It's the kind of Museum that I would have said that it's an Hidden Gem if it would have been in the middle of nowhere. However, this is New Jersey's State Museum, and they could have done a much better job.

name: Old Barracks Museum
address: 101 Barrack St, Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews: Interesting place ... Don't forget to take the tour. The staff who did the tour for us was very knowledgeable . She also was very passionate about it which reflects through out the tour.

The actors were fantastic and catered to not just the kids who we had on the field trip, but the adults who attended as well. Very fun premise to "step back in time" and act as though it were the 1770s, as well as the idea to involve the kids as much as possible. Everything was also handicap accessible, which was a huge worry (although it is a tight squeeze in the halls and elevator!) 
My favorite part was getting to watch them fire a musket blank.
Place was great. Staff and tour guide was super friendly and informative. Made me feel so welcome and I learned so much. Much thanks and props to the awesome staff.
Excellent museum. The educators and staff that work here are what really make this a great place to visit.
Very cool historical place. Guides are very informative. Definitely recommend it if you are in the area

name: Cadwalader Park
address: 36 Parkside Ave, Trenton, NJ 08618, USA
reviews: Ellarslie is always worth a visit. In addition to the historical information upstairs, the exhibits on the first floor change a few times a year.
Designed by the same designer as Central Park. Olmsted. Bucolic in the City of Trenton.
Amazing museum and performance venue. Situated in the middle of beautiful Cadwalader Park, the  Trenton City Museum within Ellarslie Mansion is a must-see and must-go!
Always enjoy this museum. Interesting local exhibits and special shows. Nice gift shop.

I went there for the first time and felt like a safe space. The grounds were well kept. This park was designed for family gatherings and joyous celebrations.
I would recommend this park for meditation only if you have extreme focus- I'm talking Yoda, Master Splinter, Grand Lotus, etc. Otherwise, you need to go explore a quieter area of the park with less distractions.
The reason I gave it three stars is because the roads need to be clearly marked for EXIT. There were motorists going top speed the opposite way down the one way streets.

name: Trenton Battle Monument in New Jersey
address: Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews: Wish this historical place had a sign or marker.  Drove past it a million times and never knew what it was.  I wish it was better taken care of and maybe more attention payed to its historical significance.  Trenton has alot of history that no one knows about.

Great statue but the interior museum is closed to the public because the elevator is over 100 years old and unsafe. Would cost a fortune to repair and the city of Trenton is strapped for cash. The granite monument is beautiful and worth a visit during the day or during a special event. It's not terribly safe for tourists at nighttime.
Not as scary as place as it was a decade ago. A beautiful sight and monument so inspiring. A must see location in American history. It started here.
On location for the ribbon cutting of the "Wellness Loop"

This is a beautiful monument and the only thing I could find in Trenton remotely related to one of the most important battles of the American Revolution. Sadly, it is somewhat dilapidated and the park around it is not well kept at all. The general surrounding neighborhood seemed fairly sketchy as well. So, if you are in Trenton, go by and see this, but don't hang out there too long.

name: Trenton City Museum/ Ellarslie Museum
address: 299 Parkside Ave, Trenton, NJ 08606, USA
reviews: Always enjoy this museum. The quilt show I went to see blew me away (Go! even if you're not "into" quilts). I will probably go back to see them again. The shop also carries interesting and artsy items, as well as original local artwork.

Solid representation of Trenton's industrial history. I learned quite a bit. Also had vibrant art displays in the first floor.

Pay as you please.

Was there for a live holiday music concert. The Italian style architecture is lovely with the beautiful art displayed throughout for sale. Unique and handcrafted items in the gift shop and the museum upstairs.
The changing exhibits are always interesting, often beautiful. Upstairs, the collection of Trenton pottery and ceramics feels warm and reassuring.
Beautiful exhibit on the 100 year history of the Trenton based firm FVHD Architects-Planners

name: 1719 William Trent House Museum
address: 15 Market St, Trenton, NJ 08611, USA
reviews:
The property for whom the City of Trenton is named.

Wall property near the Delaware River.  In the part of the city considered downtown.  Flanked by 2 courthouses and large surface parking lots.  I like see the contrast between the architecture. 

This non-profit org is a fixtured in Trenton and more recently has shifted focus on inclusion.  My most recent visit was for a committee meeting discussing the African Slaves who lived on the property and their efforts.
Well worth the visit. The Governor needs to install more Signs so tourists and interested people can better locate the historicTRENT HOUSE!
Great Historic site. In a great historic city!
Visited for Annual Hogmany celebration as part of Patriots Week. Learned some history, chatted with nice people, and toured the Trent house. It's a fun thing to do during the holidays!
A beautiful Historic site. Pleasant staff and tour guides. They had an awesome apple program wit apple cider pressing and a fine hearth cook poaching apples over a braizer. The aroma was heavenly!!

name: World War II Memorial
address: 125 W State St, Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews: Clean and shaded seating area. The lady statue has some big feet.
This is very well-done. There is a lot of information in a small space. Well designed and very interesting.
History. Period. Amazing display
Since it's closed now, unable to visit. However the opposite structure made to reflect ww2 was too little to feel overwhelmed
Tinelines of both the European and Pacific theater's are excellent

name: Grounds For Sculpture
address: 80 Sculptors Way, Hamilton Township, NJ 08619, USA
reviews: If you have nothing to do and live not too far from that place, definitely go there. It's good for the whole family. An open area for the museum setup is refreshing, inspiring and simply great. Go, enjoy, relax, get inspired by artsy ideas, bring a friend, enjoy a cup of tea or lunch in their cafe. It's great to visit in anytime except winter.

I visited with my family on one of the most coldest days of the year and although it was freezing outside we still had a wonderful time seeing all of the sculptures that we could get to. The works and their attention to detail are amazing. I highly recommend this collection if you've never been. I'd love to come back in warmer weather to see even more.

Lovely place to explore!  You have a lot of wonderful
Sculptures and outdoor art pieces.  This place is basically nature meets art work.  Such a peaceful place.  There’s a lovely place to eat too. Definitely worth it!!

really nice place to visit. Great online ticket prices although sometimes not working (good service will get you the deal during the visit). Sculptures are great! A lot to see. Pity you cannot bring dog, but makes sense as it would be mess

It is a very fun place to walk around in, but there are no paper maps for visitors or large maps other than in the main building, said a worker. He told me I would have to walk back to the first building and take a picture of the map. I would have appreciated being warned by the check-in workers when I got my wristband or preferred that there at least be a map in every large building.

Anyway, the peacocks are fun to spot, the grounds are beautiful, and the sculptures are numerous. They rotate in new sculptures, so there is something new to see every year. The Awakening giant remains one of my favorites to wander about.

name: Planetarium At Nj State Museum
address: 205 W State St, Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews: Very nice museum  and planetarium. It's small so good for kids. No cafe or restaurant, but plenty of tables where you can eat lunch from home.
Interesting place for kids and grownups. Informative and engaging presentations.
My son is 3 and loves it here. He spends most of his time in the planetarium or dinosaur fossil area. It's a great way to spend a day.
Perfect size for an afternoon trip with little ones. Gets better every time we go. Always check Groupon for a deal.
Such a nice free museum for every age.... my daughters love to walk around

name: Lower Trenton Bridge
address: Morrisville, PA 19067, USA
reviews: Beautiful structure and well maintained. The walk along the river on the bridge is a fun experience
Just a great place to check out the Delaware River and see iconic bridge!
Iconic landmark connecting Pennsylvania and New Jersey

The bridge is an oldie but goody. Its free to cross too. The bridge was recently renovated and now has color changing led lighting. It is free both ways to go over. There is a wide walkway to ride your bike over and you can take some good pics of trenton from there too. In winter you can watch the iceburgs form on the river.
Great bridge. Lights up. Gets you across the river dry. Only downside is that Pennsylvania is on the other side, but that's not really the bridge's fault.

name: New Jersey State Police Museum
address: 1040 River Rd, Ewing Township, NJ 08628, USA
reviews: Pretty great historic about New Jersey State Police and the state trooper is very nice. 😁😁
What a great museum. Beautiful tribute to the men and women who have, and are serving our state...
We enjoyed our tour through the museum. It was a nice outing for a cold rainy day.

Lots of interesting exhibits. Museum is free. They have a setup crime scene u get to help solve examine fibers and fingerprints. Lots of items from lindberg baby. Long corridor to the the log cabin exhibit along it pictures and stories of officers who died in the line of duty. Not much in log cabin but it is nice inside. You must show photo id to get through surrounding gate of complex
Small but historic museum providing information on the establishment and development of the New Jersey State Police.

name: Kuser Farm Park
address: 390 Newkirk Ave, Hamilton Township, NJ 08610, USA
reviews: Nice place to walk around and see all the Christmas lights. They put a lot of work into decorating the Kuser Manor. The train set in the basement is really cool. They have pictures with Santa for the kids. Food trucks to grab a quick bit to eat if you're hungry.
Always beautifully decorated. Enjoy walking thru here every year.

This is one of the best places to visit in the Hamilton. Inside this very historic mansion lies an antique paradise and every single room has a fairly elegant design that has been untouched since the 20th century. Here's one of the most reasons why you should respect your elders today, because they have seen and experienced it all, in which you could happily learn from

My family and I visited for Winter Wonderland and had the best time! The mansion is absolutely stunning all decorated for Christmas. We will definitely be back for another visit. This was a great family event!
This is a beautiful park with fun holiday events!

name: John A. Roebling Memorial Park
address: Hamilton Township, NJ 08610, USA
reviews: The one and only park at this point that can make you really happy and release tress and you mind. Me and my wife love this park. Especially sundown. Really clean and big enough for walking. Also you have that really good view of the water.

This park has very nice features a beautiful lake and trails. It also has the stairway from an old amusement park remarkably intact. There also are a few other remnants from old white city amusement park i believe it was closed in the early 1920s
Great place to go for bird watching, photography, going for a walk and bring the dogs to let them run.
Awesome little gem of a park hidden away on the outskirts of Hamilton. The paths are well-maintained there are constant improvements being made.
Today was beautiful day sunny,  Breeze 💨but i love this park. I took my girls today and chill with sitting in the bench took some sun and we talk. family time

name: Mill Hill Park
address: East Front Street, S Broad St, Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews: Simpy put, just an old fashioned open air park. There's a Thursday Farmers Market (May to October), free concert series every Thursday during the summer, plus a great safe open space in the middle of downtown Trenton. The walking trails that circle the park and close proximity to the historic section of Mill Hill, makes this park truly special.
Battle Reenactment 2018.  A great family event, and learn about history. Every year between Christmas and New Years during Patriots Week.  Check it out some time!

Historic location of the Battle of Trenton with George Washington defeating the British and the Hessians. Wonderfully maintained with plenty of open space, walking path and seating. Located in the "downtown" area of Trenton. Often used for events like the Pork Roll Festival, Alexander's 5k Run,  music festivals.  Easy access to parking, close to restaurants and businesses, the Mill Hill Playhouse, the Mill Hill neighborhood.

Beautiful park on the edge of Trenton. Was there for a festival put on by a local gallery. It was a perfect day, in a great outdoor space. There is even an old bridge to wall over. I hope they throw more festivals here.

Just a nice, beautiful park with some nice historic sights to stop and see i.e. Mill Hill Play House or The Bridge. There is also a nice spot to sit by the water and a kids playground as well. Probably one of the only nice parks in Trenton. Just wish it was a Little bigger.

name: Mercer County Park
address: 1638 Old Trenton Rd, West Windsor Township, NJ 08550, USA
reviews: I've been going to this park since I was probably 11 years old. Always something going on always interesting always something beautiful to see, my favorite part of the bark is definitely the 9/11 memorial. I have always felt a special connection with it and I make sure to stop byand pay my respects. Always interesting events going on. Great place to take your lunch, to go by yourself or with friends. Plenty of trails to enjoy. Amazing scenery for greenery.

Mercer County Park is a great place to experience joy. They offer many activities such as their tennis courts and their ice skating rink. You can also take a nice walk along the many paths there or try to hike a trail. All in all, it is an amazing place and you definitely should go there.

Perfect place to just "get out and go".  Playgrounds, trails, soccer fields.....my daughter loves the ice rink (skate rentals, full snack bar, restrooms, fireplace and plenty of seating inside and rink side), my husband, and son, fish the lake and creek (large mouth and small mouth bags, musky, sunnies, bluegills) and I generally enjoy just being out, while walking the dog.  The boathouse is also great for smaller wedding receptions or other parties (with good food).

Outstanding park with multiple facilities. Well maintained and clearly marked. We walked a trail, which is primarily used for HS and college cross country meets. Challenging and beautiful.  Also houses Longstreet Farms - best to check hours of operation. Nice chance to see farm animals up close.

Beautiful park with many options to enjoy nature. There is plenty of wildlife, I especially like the groundhogs. The trails are scenic and well maintained. They have a dog park, marina with paddle boats available to rent, and beautiful playgrounds. Lots of areas to have a picnic or family get together. They host lots of events, and can be packed at times.

name: Hamilton Veterans Park
address: Klockner Rd, Hamilton Township, NJ 08690, USA
reviews: A beautiful place to come. Great playgrounds (enter from the side with the airplane in the entrance), lots of parking, most of the play areas are shadowed in the summer. Great walking, scootering trails with sport activities by the way. A lake in the middle with lots of geese. Wonderful for walking with dogs.

Beautiful and very well-kept park!  Military equipment is in excellent condition and ready for battle.  Many thanks to the people who so carefully cherish the memory of the heroes and defenders of our Great country-USA !!!

This park is very beautiful with many gorgeous trails (paved and unpaved) for people to walk and use. All of the equipment is in excellent condition and the park is so large that it would be easy to spend days here and still have more trails to discover! The park also does an excellent job in representing the bravery of our troops and has something to represent each branch. The soccer, tennis, skating, and volleyball areas are also great for recreational use.
Great park which is wheelchair accessible, beautiful walking path with a nice lake
Love this park.   A ton of playgrounds for the kids, walking trails on and off road, dog park, ball fields it's the best.

name: Washington Crossing Historic Park
address: 1112 River Rd, Washington Crossing, PA 18977, USA
reviews: Washington Crossing has a variety of backdrops between historic houses and nature. It is particularly beautiful in the spring time when the trees begin flowering. If you go at the right time, its not crowded either. Overall, it’s a great place for family and maternity photo shoots.

Worth the trip to understand just how close we came to not being a nation. You will have a new appreciation for those that fought for their country.
Aside from the history, it's a very scenic area.
Easy parking, nice visitor center. Numerous things to see as you walked about. Fairly close to restaurants and little towns.

The park is great. However I called first to make sure the tower was open on March 1st and was told that it was. I then drove 90 minutes from Reading to find out that it was in fact NOT open! Get your act together people!
Beautiful state park picnic area the rivers right there and Jersey is a hop and skip away nice place to relax and and enjoy beautiful homes near by a lot to explore

name: Sayen House and Gardens
address: 155 Hughes Dr, Hamilton Square, NJ 08690, USA
reviews: What a great discovery we made today.  Beautiful gardens.  Peaceful walk around the area.  A beautiful pond with koi fish.  A marshy pond with tons of frogs mating.  I can't wait to go back when everything is green.
Wow! Very very nice. A great place to spend a nice day. Recommend.
Very nice place for an outing in the spring & summer. Nice scenery when in blossom season.
Love this place. Even though it’s on the smaller size it’s absolutely gorgeous and my Lucy loves going for walks there. Not too much. Ran into such nice people too

Lovely little park! I really liked the look pond especially, as well as the little winding paths. It looks like a lovely setting for a wedding on top of it (there was a wedding and baby photo shoot occuring while we were there). If you want a good place to photograph, I recommend this place. It must be beautiful in the spring especially

name: Amazing Escape Room Princeton New Jersey
address: 3490 US-1 #15a, Princeton, NJ 08540, USA
reviews: Had so much fun at the escape room. We did the Knight's Quest and Jason was the most amazing game master! He had such a great energy and positive attitude. He kept us laughing and made sure we didn't give up! He gave clues at the perfect time without giving anything away or spoiling the fun of the game. We would highly recommend going to the Amazing Escape Room in Princeton and anyone who gets Jason as their game master is in for such a fun time!

Very well done escape room.  We did the Speakeasy room with 8 people and although we didn't conquer it we all thought it was done very well and had a great time.  Staff was nice and helpful and we'd love to go back and try again.  No pictures allowed in the rooms, so I'm only able to post one of the area where they take your picture when you're done.

What a blast!  We reserved 4 Escape Rooms for a team building event and folks had a great time!  Loved the guidelines/rules provided (folks can leave the room and the game still continues - no disqualification!) and the staff was very welcoming and engaging.  It's amazing how fast 60 minutes flies by!  Will, for sure, do this again!

We had a wonderful time as a birthday gift  in the Pawn shop robbery experience. Arthur was a terrific host. We were 5in late but we're able to solve 5 out of 7 puzzles. Feeling proud. This was our second time. We enjoyed this one more than the great train heist!

Helpful staff and a fun experience! The clues in the room tested our wits. The staff is able to keep an eye on us in the room and offer clues and entertainment with their sense of humor.  Could make for a great team- building activity. Can be hard to find this place as you drive or after you park.

name: BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir, Robbinsville
address: 112 N Main St, Windsor, NJ 08561, USA
reviews: BAPS is a very nice, new and peaceful temple. The architecture and design of both the inside and outside is very beautiful and marvelous. Inside of temple is made from all marble with incredible intricate designs. They have done an incredible job carving and constructing America's largest Hindu temple. The food court (cafeteria) is amazing, they have a very large variety of great foods at a cheap price. There are many volunteers who are all very friendly and the area is always kept clean. Love this temple and would recommend for everyone to check out.

Marble architecture that makes this amongst the most beautiful temples made in contemporary times and  its so accessible is amazing. You don't have to be a Hindu to visit the temple. you can go to visit, just have to have reverence and respect for a place of worship and people around who are praying. you will see people of other races visiting. they provide audio tours. if you are uncomfortable find an Indian friend and take a trip. a must visit place.

The architecture looked like a wonder. The vibrations of this temple is amazing. Very very friendly and kind staff. The cafeteria is just awesome. The crowd is managed very efficiently. Very well maintained campus. Plenty of parking space. A must visit place in USA

BAPS Shri Swaminarayan Mandir is very nice and peaceful temple. The architecture and design is marvelous. Inside of temple is made from marble. It’s not easy to carve marble. But they have done incredible job. 
It is not allowed to take pictures inside of temple but can take pictures from outside. It is not allowed to wear shorts or sleeveless blouse inside the temple else have to put wraparound provided in temple.

Nice temple. Clean. Worth going and having a full platter of Indian gods. The canteen food is poor quality. Lot of insects and worms so beware. The packed food is fine but most of the Indian sweets are loaded with insane calories so it might crash your diet or workout results. Canteen is managed by some retired old men and they are not at all descent at the billing counter. Also the tray system sucks for picking up stuff. Over all architecturally it's amazing and the pond right outside is beautiful . The peacock I saw was just beautiful. Check out the pics

name: Rosedale Park
address: 424 Federal City Rd, Pennington, NJ 08534, USA
reviews: Love this dog park! There's always lots of friendly dogs and people here. Plenty of space for everyone to run around! Gets a little muddy when it rains, but otherwise you can't find a better dog park.

Well it a good place to let your dogs play with other dog, and get information of thing dog for dogs. I was at the park yesterday when a man( Sean ) with his dog came in the park. He had a power drill.  He went to all the picnic tables and fixed all the lose bolts. How nice of him, I guess that's pet people
I love how many parks are throughout NJ. First time visiting this one. It was beautiful. Cool breeze and plenty of shade cover if need be. I will return, and recommend checking it out..
Great walk. Easy to follow paths. Many options of short strolls to long walks.
The playground here is amazing! My son loves it. It's very clean and in good shape. He loves to go down to the water and look for fish. We haven't been to the dog park but it looks nice too!

name: Core Creek Park
address: 901 Bridgetown Pike, Langhorne, PA 19047, USA
reviews: I absolutely love walking around this park with my dog. Just wonderful nature. A nice lake to look at and enjoy plenty of picnic areas as well as playgrounds for the kids. Some restrooms on site if you know where to go. Definitely check it out fun for all bring your bikes plenty of trails as well.
My dog and I love going here for walks. She enjoys running on the grass the most! She also likes the scenery and sometimes gets too interested in the wildlife. 10/10 would walk here again.

This is a very nice medium sized park. The reason I take off a few stars is because it's full of plastic trash, under every Bush and tree there are bottles, bags and other garbage. I'm now bringing a bag with me regularly to pickup any trash I see here, hopefully over time it will become better. People please clean up after your selves! And pick up the trash you see around you!

One of our favorite parks in the area. Never crowded, a variety of playgrounds throughout the park (my kids love that), lots of trails to walk, boats to rent, access to the lake, lots of athletic fields, and more. 
A great park that is right up the street.
I take my daughter here regularly. Great place for a nice walk through the woods. Playground for the kids and nice lake to watch the birds and kayaks when it’s not too cold.

name: Princeton Battlefield State Park
address: 500 Mercer Rd, Princeton, NJ 08540, USA
reviews: Small but lovely park of enormous historical importance: the turning point if the Revolutionary War, where Washington was headed after he crossed the Delaware. The oak tree where general Mercer died during the battle finally have or a decade ago but is being regrown from one of its acorns. The park also connects to hundreds of acres of woods in the Institute for Advanced Studies, where Einstein used to walk.
Very interesting.   Lived 10 minutes away my whole life and never knew it was there.  Would definitely luke to go again and see reenactment.
Good historic park. You can get pre wedding shoot here as it will give you a good scenery and monument as background!!
The battlefield guide was excellent. He brought the battle to life and painted an excellent picture. There's not a lot in the house but I really enjoyed the whole experience.

I took one of their monthly tours yesterday. It was awesome! Both guides were extremely knowledgeable. It was my second time having Kim as one of the guides. He was my guide at another historic museum down the street. He really takes the time to answer your questions! If you do the tour though, I recommend bringing bug spray or wear long sleeves. I definitely will go back again and take my wife next time.

name: Trinity Church
address: 33 Mercer St, Princeton, NJ 08540, USA
reviews: Splendid and exquisite. I had an opportunity to attend the Christmas Eve service. It was beautiful.
Beautiful church, welcoming congregation. Anyone can take communion.
We are glad for this church and for the community! Very welcoming to all people, excellent choir! For someone looking for a liturgically oriented worship, this is the place!

Richard Upjohn and mainly his son build this one in Gothic revival style. Richard Upjohn was associated with rebuilding of Trinity Church on Broadway and Wall Street. Beautiful and imposing structure.
Beautiful church located in beautiful Princeton...Had a mist heart warming welcome..everyone very friendly and open..If you ate ever in Princeton stop in to see the Church..

name: White Hill Mansion
address: 217 4th St, Fieldsboro, NJ 08505, USA
reviews: You have to check website this place is open on specific datee and times. Guided tour cost $5. The volumteers are eager to answer your questions and will tell you of a few ghost stories. Definitely worth the visit

We went here for the Krampus Bazaar. The building itself was a Paranormal investigators dream. The building definitely had a historic and spooky vibe to it. Almost every room was open to explore. The main 2 floors had vendors and to my surprise they were much more interesting than I expected. Kind of like a Punk Rock flea market quality of stuff if you have ever been.

Great historical place.  I won't even spoil it for you but if you have any interest in history, the paranormal, mob related speakeasy, yoga, painting or just want something different to do, please check it out.   Such an interesting place.  Be sure to see when their open houses, special events or ghost hunts are.  It is worth it.
Had a great time with ghost hunts USA!!  Thanks Rob for a great night
itjust wanted to say your buitfull #love

name: Roebling Museum
address: 100 2nd Ave, Roebling, NJ 08554, USA
reviews: This is a great museum.  The staff is full of  knowledge about the Mill, The Roebling family and everything they did.  It is a fun little visit and you could spend a lot of time there.

We took a large group of special needs adults to  The Roebling  Museum twice so far. They have a wonderful staff and are very accommodating. Our tour guide, (Caren Cronin), was amazing and customized the tour for each of our groups needs. Caren even modified the hands on bridge building portion of the experience to meet each of our groups abilities. Thank you Roebling Museum for a great day of learning and fun! 🌷

So amazing - you owe it to yourself to go here. Ive lived here the past 30 years, and I didnt realize the impact Roebling had on the world. Its a great time! You need maybe 3 hours to see it all. Go and see yourself!

We love this small museum! The Roebling story is amazing, and the more you know about the family and their achievements, the more interesting it becomes. The museum is not too visible from the road, but once you pass the gates, they have a good amount of parking. The building itself is is nicely organized, with well-constructed and informative displays spread out among the various rooms. One of my favorite things is a painting of the view from (what is now) a main door; it shows you what was there when the complex was full of large industrial buildings. They even discuss how the town was one of the first "factory towns" in America. I definitely recommend this museum for young and old. It's definitely worth the ride!
Nice museum next to the Delaware river!

name: Howell Living History Farm
address: 70 Woodens Ln, Lambertville, NJ 08530, USA
reviews: The last time I came here was 2 years ago and the place looks just like it did then.  Because there weren't any one else visiting at the time that we went we were able to get 1 on 1 treatment with the animals.  My children were able to fetch water as well as retrieve some eggs from the hens. They open up the barn so my kids could get out photo with the horses and also explained how to properly pet the sheep. will be back soon! awesome place to escape for free and let kids run around to breathe fresh air.

A great family place to visit. Every volunteer is ready to share interesting facts about the animals on the farm. The food is made from what is harvested in the farm. Everyone is friendly and knowledgeable. On weekends, they have different stations - blacksmith, kettle popcorn maker, and horse pulled hayrides. The walk to that hayride is super enjoyable as there is no pavement and you walk on a simple county road and over a small creek passing beautiful evergreens. Don’t miss the chicken shed as you will know some interesting facts about hens.
Magical!  My wife and I attended the honey harvesting but there is so much much more to this place. Friendly people and great farm animals to interact with. Highly recommended!

Beautiful farm and history. I had my nephews ages 8 and 10 - we went on a week day. Not so exciting. Nice to see and pet the animals.
I hear the weekends are packed with lots of fun.

Really great place to visit for 19th century farm experience. They have a ton of stuff going on. We went in December for their Barn dance.  Had a blast! Watch their website for upcoming events. You won't be disappointed!

name: Six Flags Great Adventure
address: 1 Six Flags Blvd, Jackson Township, NJ 08527, USA
reviews: The Wonder Woman ride is probably one of the most unique rides and terrifying rides. I highly suggest it if you are looking for a thrilling ride that is not a roller coaster. Also I just enjoy the big roller coaster as their a variety of ones and they are all great rides.

I've been going to Six Flags since I was very young and I think I've recently  been able to fully appreciate the greatness of this park. Fright Fest and Holidays in the Park are my favorite times to go. I'm a member, so I also enjoy visiting the other Six Flags parks and believe this brand does a great job at giving their customers a good time.

Six Flags Great Adventure is so much fun!!! I so totally recommend this park for thrill seekers and for people who are just in for the amusement. I also recommend this park for those who are visiting New Jersey for whatever occasion you find yourself in! The Holiday in the Park is also pretty and the park looks beautiful lit up in all of those Christmas lights! I also recommend going in the spring or summer as well! Overall, an awesome park with some thrilling rides!!!

Not only is the park itself amazing in Six Flags, but so it the positive attitude thats goes around. This is my first ever job, and the way I am treated here is making me love it. The company is so generous and gives plenty of benefits. There is no better place than Six Flags Great Adventure.

This place is one of the best 6 flags I have ever been to. They have amazing rides and even a safari! The park is huge. So big that the water park is not even connected to it. I loved the safari! I saw so many animals and it’s nice that they give you and option to get out at the half way point to visit with other animals in a museum type area and there is drinks/ food at this stop too. One more thing the food is really good at this six flags too so much to pick from here.

name: Columbus Farmers Market
address: 2919 US-206, Columbus, NJ 08022, USA
reviews: I come here mostly for the Amish market, which is great. I shop there for both ingredients and prepared foods. If there's time, I stroll around through the rest of the building but I usually don't buy anything because I'm already loaded up by that time. It's an older building with odd bumpy floors and a random assortment of stores. If you explore, you're sure to find something that interests you, and something that turns you off. As I mentioned, I don't do much else there except wander. With the exception of the winery -- I really enjoy their Mead. Oh and the produce stands across the parking lot. Great stuff. I never go on the weekends in summer so I can't report on the flea market. One day I'll get there. To avoid crowds, and to maximize the selection of donuts, best time to go is around 9 or 10 am. on a Thursday or Friday. It gets super crowded at lunch, and donuts fly off the shelves. 😁🍩

It's busy but it's an awesome place to check out cheap products if all kind. All kinds of good food vendors in one place. Fun family outing for the day. Very dense with people so keep eyes on your little ones!

Great place to shop when you are looking for some deals and discounts. Many shops to choose from, weekends are always packed and it's best to get there a head of time, friendly owners and it even has a food court if you need a break. My only downfalls for this place is that it's dated and isn't always clean. I feel if they added some new paint colors or add some flare to the place it would make it a little easier on the eyes but otherwise those are my only gripes with the place. I would recommend shopping here, even if you are just looking for a flea market and not outdoor vendors.

They are the Best. You can Pretty much find everything you are looking for. Also, it was always a pleasant experience to weather you are buying or selling there. Weather you are New Or Used the Prices for a Table Are Reasonable. That used to be our Saturday morning date. We would get hot chocolate walk around shop & talk. It was great. That was our Special Time Together Alone Away from kids etc. OMG Columbus Market How we Miss You! We will be back when are out that way, for Sure!

Lots of good stuff here.  Buy it's the food that brings me here most often.  Pete's pizza,  the Amish Market with roasted chickens and delicious, fall of the bone ribs. Excellent Korean place, Mexican, Polish, sandwiches,  one of the best fried chicken places around.  All good and reasonably priced.

name: Princeton Battle Monument
address: 55 Stockton St, Princeton, NJ 08540, USA
reviews: Nice memorial located near the Morven House. Could use a nice cleaning (as of January 2020) but it is still a nice memorial to visit. There are a few other memorials and plaques near by, including a new one for Einstein.  The Peacock Inn is located nearby which is a nice place to stop in for a drink.
I love history and taking photographs its located down from the university(middle of town)

Very cool historic spot with additional surrounding sculptures and museums. We came a bit too late for the museums to be open so there's not much time to be occupied in this particular spot, but it's not far from the shopping district and many other streets with very old architecture to see.
Beautiful monument. Good place for a photo opportunity in Princeton.
I liked the outdoor experience and the monument was nice. Worth seeing and learning about the history.

name: Washington Crossing State Park, NJ
address: 355 Washington Crossing Pennington Rd, Titusville, NJ 08560, USA
reviews:
The visitor center had some nice exhibits of period costume and hardware used. There was a lot to read and learn about the area and the major people involved in the preparation for, completion of the crossing of the Delaware and the raid on Trenton.

A US history buff will not be disappointed!

New Jersey side of Washington Crossing Park. There is a visitor’s center here with a few historic buildings but this is more of a park than the Pennsylvania side. Here there’s a nature center and trails. Interesting tidbit is to be careful with your waste. No garbage cans. Pack in. Pack out. Even if you’re just parking your car for an afternoon lunch. Plenty of picnic tables under shady trees.
Great place to just enjoy the day and some nj history! Great place for a long walk and great exercise!

A lovely park. Friendly and informative staff at the visitors' center. Amazing Rev-War collection and display. The Johnson Ferry House is a rare treasure from the Rev-War period; the only structure on either side of the river that actually witnessed and was directly involved in the history Crossing for the Battle of Trenton. The interpreters at the Johnson Ferry House really know their stuff!

For students of the American Revolution this is a must see. The park has interesting trails and a great view of the river crossing area. For hikers and those interested in history it is worth a visit.

name: Pennsbury Manor
address: 400 Pennsbury Memorial Rd, Morrisville, PA 19067, USA
reviews: What a fantastic, peaceful time.  Haven't been since I was a kid and I still love it.  I took my wife and my son for their first time and they both loved it.  The staff is super friendly and very knowledgeable.  We will definitely be returning!!!

A great place for a visit on the shore of the Delaware River. Our super cool and unique tour guide Kelly gave a fantastic tour filled with interesting historical facts about the history here   . Part farm and part re- created estate , Kelly led us across the estate from the visitors center and through the manor house and then into the kitchen house. A must see if in the Morrisville area!!

Amazing hidden gem! The land it is built on is just as interesting as the Manor. As much info as you want and room for kids to run around. Farming, blacksmith and cooking demonstrations happening in the day we went.
Wonderful historic site to visit, especially bring your animal lover as they have a working farm. A beautiful property with great character preservation.
Great history here. Staff is knowledgeable & helpful, although noticeably weary from year-end school field trip frenzy.

name: Princeton University Chapel
address: Princeton, NJ 08544, USA
reviews: Chapel is not an appropriate word for what seems more like a cathedral of the first order! This church is staggeringly beautiful! I popped in while musicians were rehearsing for Wed. night "Jazz Vespers". It was so awesome to hear such impeccable music echoing off the walls of this spectacular building!

Felt like  nostalgic place. It's like once upon time.....ohh..not boring you guys...but 2 decades back graduated from second oldest engineering college of India and today visited one of the finest Universities of USA. It gives an immense feeling of " back to school"....this  chapel is crown of the university campus.

Beautiful, historical and simply an ideal place for knowledge.

I can't imagine how being a student here could feel. If you come here and you don't learn, you are a plant.

Museum, library, dormitories, sports facilities, coffee shops, everything.

I'd say you can survive here without a car because they are bicycle friendly, but not sure, there are some places around that a student would like to visit like kayaking places.

Knowledge is in the air here. Of course an opinion from an actual student would be required, but as a visitor I was impressed.
Beautiful chapel. Went for my daughter's high school Big Sing. Sound was fantastic. The whole experience was beyond words.

Great tour, hard to get into (4-6% acceptance rate). 
Beautiful campus, undergraduate academics and such history!!

name: Tyler State Park
address: 101 Swamp Rd, Newtown, PA 18940, USA
reviews: Definitely one of my favorite local parks! There’s both cement and gravel trails for hiking or biking. Everyone comes here to walk their dogs. I wish it wasn’t so congested at times but it’s a big park to explore and get some exercise! Plus they have some fun rental stuff like SUPS, kayaks and canoes. There are pretty regularly horses in the park, so be prepared to stand clear of them if they’re walking by.

This park is absolutely beautiful. It is well manicured and taken care of. I always enjoy coming here. It is clean and safe. The bathrooms when open are taken care of. I absolutely adore coming here and will be visiting many times in the future.
Beautiful park! It has everything you need in a park. It’s frisbee golf course is challenging and beautiful! It’s a large park that gives room for people to space out.

This is a huge park and very good to walk your dogs at. Theres tons of diffrent trails on all sorts of hills. They have horse trails and you can go canoeing in the creek too. They have big picnic areas and dams to take cool pics near. They have restrooms and several benches to rest your feet. The park has a covered bridge you can walk through and several old farmhouses to look at.
So pretty and well kept.  The disc golf course is awesome.  Challenging and fun without being discouraging.

name: Morven Museum & Garden
address: 55 Stockton St, Princeton, NJ 08540, USA
reviews: Morven Museum is a beautiful spot. I came for the Roosevelt exhibit and was very impressed. It's really great to dive deeper into our local history... makes you appreciate your surroundings much more. I collect pins and was happy to see a pin honoring their  festival of trees. Easy to find. They have on site parking, but we parked in Palmer Square and enjoyed a nice walk over.

Paid for a tour here and I guess I expected way more than was there. When it says “gardens” I think: multiple, lush, gardens that offer a variety to enjoy. But this really is one garden that’s the size of a very small backyard. I was really surprised given the advertising and website just how tiny it was. There are 2 smaller gardens that have veggies as well, but they are mini gardens at best. Honestly, if you aren’t really into local history and just dying to see a tiny garden (and not the original one- those garden plans have been lost), I would skip it.

A nice museum in a colonial period house. Good place to visit if you are interested in local history or the Revolutionary War. I would recommend taking the tour as the guides are friendly and knowledgable. But you are also able to explore the house yourself and there are plenty of displays that will walk you through the history.
I love going here for The Festival of Trees every Christmas.  So beautiful!
Beautiful, Historical. New Art Gallery upstairs has a very moving Civil Rights collection!

name: Hopewell Valley Vineyards
address: 46 Yard Rd, Pennington, NJ 08534, USA
reviews:
A very nice spot. I didn't get to see it in the day but would go back to check it out. Tried two wines that were pretty good. Live music was fun and staff were very nice too!

Not to get too picky but the driveway could be better lit as well as the entrance area from the road.

Really nice vineyard. Very beautiful grounds and nice interior. The wines we tried were very good. All around great experience.

Ideal for couples or small groups.

My family and I visited Hopewell Valley Vineyard on 12/31/19. To say that we had a wonderful time is an understatement! James was friendly, knowledgeable, hospitable and kind.  He is a true asset to the winery! We had such a fun time and will definitely return soon! Thanks, James! 😀
Wine was ok. The atmosphere their was real cozy. They do alot of live music during the weekend.

Family owned and operated winery in Hopewell NJ.

Easy access from Rte 31.  Picturesque grounds with good views year round.  Large crushed red stone parking area. Can be messy if wet.

Beautiful tasting room with exposed stone and seating for ~50 ppl.  Upper room with retail offerings, good for small parties.

Stage area with live music, decent acoustics.

Visual Art of various styles is usually on display, most of which is for sale.

Staffed by a knowledgeable and willing to assist team.  After several choices I settled on a red blend that reminded me of light "chianti."

I enjoyed a fresh made Sicilian Pizza with Salami (Pepperoni)

Fair prices and a little bit of a wait, but worth it.

name: Neshaminy State Park
address: 3401 State Rd, Bensalem, PA 19020, USA
reviews: It typically gets a little busy by the parking lot, even on weekdays. Lots of people enjoying barbecues or having kids birthday parties. Once you walk the trail a bit you see less people. The little shore is nice, and the Philadelphia skyline is beautiful. If you walk the full trail around it’s a perfect distance for someone like me (who isn’t very athletic or..... walkative.) There are maps by the front. There is a “scenic overlook” that isn’t very scenic, but the overall walk is very pretty and enjoyable. If you show up earlier in the morning there are sometimes deer. Also a great place to take photography.

Neshaminy State park is small it needs to commandeer 2 miles south past the campsite for the future the government has the money and it will give the federal government the ability to protect the waterways forever long past my day.... could use 100 Boy Scouts to clean up the debris low tide River's Edge by having a natural buffer you will create a Nature's Jewel.

I went there for the 1st time yesterday. I actually really enjoyed it. There's a lot to do and a lot to see. I just can't wait for the summer for when the trees are green. It's very clean. I would definitely recommend coming here to anybody that is looking for a park to go to. Especially if you're into photography.

Great place to go with the kids or just with my camera. Lots of wooded area with wildlife. Also trails that go right down along the Delaware River. Can walk the trails bring the kids bike/scooter and ride the paved areas. Either or it’s a relaxing place and close by.

One of my favorite places ever. Beautiful river views, plenty of winding trails, a large open field for recreation, and safely patrolled. It's easy to forget that Philly is only a couple of miles away, as Neshaminy is so heavily wooded.  I often spot deer, beavers, and other forest critters during my visits. I especially enjoy walking my dog along the river beach.

Weekends and summer holidays this place is jam packed, so I recommend visiting Neshaminy on weekdays and cooler weather weekends and other off times.

name: Bowman’s Hill Tower
address: 1 Tower Rd, New Hope, PA 18938, USA
reviews: Wonderful Morning Fall adventure location!  Got there right when the park opened. Make sure you bring a pair of binoculars - or ask to borrow a set when you purchase your ticket ($7 admission - borrow binoculars for free by leaving your license/ID with the visitor center staff). Swing by the Washington’s Crossing visitor center on your way out as well. It’ll give you the full experience. Highly recommend the visit. Great view of the Delaware River Valley.
Very beautiful place. Feel like the fee to go to the top of the tower should be free. Comparing it to other places with high elevation and view. But I had fun and enjoyed the view of the river
Loved the views,  office was closed so we couldn't go up even tho it was listed as open on the web
Perfect place to go to see fall colors! Take your drone if you have one. You won't be disappointed.

This place is so pretty. You can see really far into the surrounding area and during the Fall, it is absolutely gorgeous. The view alone is worth it but seems like a nice place to hike if you like uphills

name: Maclean House
address: Nassau St &, Elm Dr, Princeton, NJ 08544, USA
reviews:
Aaron Burr was a baby while his family occupied this house. Aaron Burr Sr. And the his family were the first occupants of this house. 

Fits architecture is Philadelphia Georgian.
Very clean very well maintained. Beautiful building
Really cool

name: New Hope-Lambertville Bridge
address: W Bridge St, New Hope, PA 18938, USA
reviews: Love to go there and just walk around. It is so beautiful and peaceful but most of the time crowded
Walking over the bridge provides scenic views  from both NJ and PA. Perfect for a quick day trip.
Love the area I live in... I love my home ♥️
Amazing, Beautiful towns of New Hope and Lambertville are a must visit for all
Nice place with small shops, restaurants. Ideal for evening walks in summer.

name: The Funplex
address: 3320-24 NJ-38, Mt Laurel Township, NJ 08054, USA
reviews: Just had my daughters birthday party there yesterday she turned 12, was displeased because my reservation confirmation said 4:30-6:30, our party host made us clear everything out by 6 let me know at 5:50 things had to start going because there was another party coming in and she had to clean up, there also was only one slice of pizza and one drink cup provided for every hungry/thirsty child that plays for hours. Pizza is not that expensive they can afford to provide each child a minimum of 2 slices if they desired plus a slice for the only 4 adults that came to partake in my child’s birthday party. Would not recommend this place for a birthday.

One of the best staff ever! I decided to take my little sister to The Funplex and it was the first time for both us, everyone was so helpful especially Kaitlyn Walter she helped me and my sister a lot :) Overall a great experience! 10/10 recommend if you’re trying to have some fun.
Had my younger sister's birthday party here. It went wonderful! Staff was great, arcade is really cool, you're actually able to win stuff from the crane machines, I was happy with that.
We had my daughters 7th. birthday party here today. The ladies did a great job organizing the events. The kids had a blast and my daughter had a great party. Definitely recommend this location.

I just had my daughters party there the other weekend. I had an extremely good experience with a lovely girl named Brianna she was an amazing party host. But I would have to say a girl named Haley was absolutely so rude. One of my daughters friends had went up to her to ask a question and she was extremely unprofessional and rude. Just from that experience alone I would say I would never come back but the lovely young lady Brianna saved the day I will only be back because of her and if she is available to be my daughters party host!

name: Historic Smithville Park
address: 803 Smithville Rd, Eastampton Township, NJ 08060, USA
reviews: A beautiful treasure in Burlington Country.  Tons of parking and if you select the wrong one it's an easy walk to the right location .   They have a filled schedule of activities throughout the summer for all ages.  Check their website out for more details.  If this review was helpful please give it this thumbs up.
Great park, nice trails, you can be in the woods, open areas, take a kayak ride, bring dogs, explore the old buildings on site.  Very clean and well kept park!!

Absolutely gorgeous! Can't wait to see all the leaves change. Only thing I wish there were more of is bathrooms. The public bathroom is just one toilet, no stalls. It is very clean and comfortable but it's inconvenient when you're walking the trails. A port-a-potty in the parking lots would be great!

It's so quite and there's a lot of trails you can take. They have picnics and baroque there plus there a playground for kids. My favorite trail is the green trail, you get to walk across a long bridge.

Beautiful, scenic and clean park. Perfect for a stroll with your dog, as a family or simply by yourself for some meditation. I enjoy the butterfly garden and trails. Playground area for the little ones is also a bonus!

name: Institute Woods
address: Princeton Pike, Princeton, NJ 08540, USA
reviews: Beautiful area to walk around. Lots of nature and also history. This is the area through which Washington's army marched on their way to Princeton. The battlefield is nearby. You can walk dogs here and it is a fun place for kids.
Very nice park. The suspension bridge was a nice surprise. Can definitely get muddy after a lot of rain. But very nice overall.
Beautiful trails through the woods makes for a wonderful afternoon walk. Great place for families and Kurds to explore nature.
Great for running, watch out for mud
Make sure you have a map or gps on phone. It is muddy, but worth it. Absolutely love it here. Woodlands to meadow with great views of farmland.

name: Historic Smithville Mansion
address: 801 Smithville Rd, Eastampton Township, NJ 08060, USA
reviews: Absolutely Beautiful Park.  Great walking trails and very clean.  Play park for kids.  Barbeque grills available and you can rent space for parties as well.  There is a beautiful butterfly garden in the warmer months.  Just a great place for a walk  hike or a run.

Great trails that are fairly level and interesting. There's a floating bridge that is both scenic and has some interesting historic details of the area. Have been there three times in the past couple of weeks. Dog loves it too.

It’s my first time walking in this park. There are easy and short trails & lakeside boardwalks to walk with some historic sites to see. There’s a pretty size of playground for kids to play with seating for parents to watch. And there are lots of seatings around the park. There are also some kayaking access to Rancocas Creek. See some of the pictures I posted on Google Map.

I love Smithville, go there every chance I can and usually lots of beautiful pictures are taken there.
Nature walks and relaxing n sometimes even barbecuing... Time well spent for sure 👍🏽😊🤩
Serene and comforting place.  Historical balm for the soul. A NJ gem.

name: Falls Township Community Park
address: 9050 Mill Creek Rd, Levittown, PA 19054, USA
reviews: Very nice place good walking path/biking path. Very nice dark park. Very Nice Playground area and skate boarding area..Nice patrolled area area rangers. A nice little boating ramp and fishing lake with a nice dock. Over all a nice local park
Nice path around the lake and pavilions to reserve for family events.  Bathrooms were clean and stocked when I visited. Skate park makes it a unique destination if you're into that.
Good place to take kids if you are looking to get them out of the house. Or just get out yourself. I love this park!

I love this park across our apartment complex. I take my dog here every morning he loves to swim in the lake and power walk with me in the 3.23 mi loop around the lake and the field. He also enjoys meeting new friends in the dog park that's open from 930am till sunset. In the weekend my husband and i go kayaking or fishing in the lake we don't have drive far to go kayaking! Great for family and friends! The rangers are so friendsly as well.
Beautiful 2 mile path around the lake.

name: Burlington County Prison Museum
address: 128 High St, Mt Holly, NJ 08060, USA
reviews: Great place to visit and learn about Burlington County Prison history, we took our children and they learned and enjoyed the experience as well.
We had a great time! Very interesting and filled with lots of history. Highly recommended if your into historical places.
It was a great experience for me and my children.
Such a cool place to explore. Went there on a saturday and the gentleman working the front desk was incredibly knowledgeable,  friendly, and helpful! Worth checking out!!
Been there for a facility tour and for a paranormal investigation. Such history and stories.

name: Adventure Aquarium
address: 1 Riverside Dr, Camden, NJ 08103, USA
reviews:
This is a decent aquarium. It has a nice tunnel to walk through and the kids really enjoy the shark bridge, a webbed net bridge you walk over the shark tank on. They also really liked petting the sharks in one of the touch tanks. The problem is for the price you get less than you do at other aquariums. This is probably due to it being a fire profit rather than a nonprofit business.

It seems like they give lots of opportunities to spend money, more so than is typical. It feels like that takes away from part of the experience. They also do not seem to worry too much about meeting their own published schedules. Numerous things were late or seemed to be fine as afterthoughts.

Overall it is a fine place to visit once or twice
I would not see wanting to keep going back like I do most aquariums.

It was a perfect size for our little guy. Our two teenagers zipper through it pretty quick. It has a little bit of everything. The wait outside was long, but it moved quickly. You have to go through the metal detectors, so when it's cold outside, it can feel like the process is taking forever. Once your inside, it's quite warm. We did not eat there, but it looked like basic kid friendly food. It was pretty crowded at some spots, but not unbearable.

Best experience for me and my kids it was my first time to an Aquarium and i highly recommend!!! it’s beautiful fun for parents an kids food was great I recommend ordering the tickets online through there website we got the meal an drink added with it made the day perfect after a fun filled day. Super fun u won’t regret it parking is $10 for the day. I’ll definitely be back loved it an so did my kids. Loved the shark tunnel

Love coming here on weekends for the kids to expand their minds learning about aquatic life. We got season passes which I highly recommend. This place is great for kids of all ages only down side is the food and gift shop is extremely highly priced so eat before you go and skip the gift shop if you don’t want to spend $20 for one item.
Very nice! Since we went on a week day it was not too busy, even with kids on spring break. I loved how you could touch some of the animals and the shark tank was cool! The turtles we showing off.😊

name: Monmouth Battlefield State Park
address: 16 Business Route 33, Manalapan Township, NJ 07726, USA
reviews: Bee going here ever since I was a little kid! Reenactments where always a highlight, and the museum is fantastic, with a great view of the majority of the park. Fun for light hikes all year round with well maintained trails. You may see all manner of animals as well from deer to foxes. A tip: popping on over to battlefield orchards when the hike is done is always great.

One of the largest battles of the American Revolution took place in the fields and forests that now make up Monmouth Battlefield State Park. The park encompasses a playground for the kids, trails for light hiking and bicycle riding, picnic areas, a restored Revolutionary War farmhouse and a visitors center.
There is also the Battle of Monmouth Reenactment which is an annual event held each June at the park. Children can also participate in the cannon and musket drill that day. A treat for the young and old.
Note: There are stations with plastic bags for the owners to pick up your furry babies poo. There are plenty of garbage bins for you to throw it away.

Very beautiful historical park.  Informative display and movie in the visitor center, with friendly staff as well. Wish their were dedicated paths leading down to the battlefield, only because I felt bad walking on the grass. Definitely worth the visit.

This is 1 of the most beautiful places I have been to in NJ.  I took so many beautiful pictures of my kids there.  The Apple orchard on the Battlefield is a welcomed byproduct as well, although the saving grace of it all is the ambiance.  Everyone should take a walk here in early fall.
Great historical park and really educational. Neat place to visit even if history isnt your thing. Perfect place for a picnic too!

name: Parx Casino
address: 2999 Street Rd, Bensalem, PA 19020, USA
reviews: If you're looking for a place to unwind on a Saturday prax offers an excellent alternative. After a wonderful day with a good friend we decided to stop off and try our hand with the slots. It was a great way to spend an hour and I was happy to see my friend leave with more than he came. The energy that you feel in a casino with all the lights, colors and sounds is palatable. It makes for an excellent distraction for a few hours. Enjoy!

Great atmosphere. Plenty of room to move around. Drinks are free and not watered down. The food is amazing. Variety of slots to choose from. You will and can win at slots. Haven't tried the table games yet. But people seem to be having fun playing them. Be a winner in no time and go to the Park. You won't regret it.

Clean establishment, cocktail waitresses are very nice and prompt. Food is amazing and if you keep up with the player perks you get some really good rewards. They have valet parking which I've never tried and the only down part is the ID check before entering the floor. I've had to return back to my car a couple times before because I forgot.

Best Casino by far in a 200 mile radius. Your first impression when strolling on to Park is...WOW! Has a young and hip vibe for sure. They are professional. Pay promptly and offer multiple payout options. Thanks Parx Casino!!! 5 Stars....

Its a large open space. Has lots of slots and a huge table playing area. Staff are friendly and they actually compensate you for playing sending out free slot plays and comps monthly. Very neat. Bathrooms are up to fancy. Service is exceptional. One of my go it's when i want to play!

name: Peace Valley Park
address: 230 Creek Rd, Doylestown, PA 18901, USA
reviews: Great county park to spend the day with the family or walking the dogs. This place is well maintained and typically very clean. Great walking paths that get you close to the water or out in the middle of the woods. The boat rentals are not bad (just get their early or be prepared to wait during the weekends). They also have a few playgrounds for the little ones. Great place to watch the sun set or rise!

A great place to get some exercise on the trails, both paved and unpaved. Great place for a family picnic, small group gathering or just by yourself. It has become very popular and the biggest problem is adequate parking area on busy weekends. Otherwise a great place to get some fresh air and sunshine.

I've been going here since I was a boy. Paddleboat rental in the summer, feeding ducks in the winter. Plenty of space. I actually take my children there now. Whenever the sun shines my daughter wants to go to the lake!

What an amazing place for a walk, jog and or run! As the name mentions, Peace Valley Park is certainly a peaceful place. Great place to unwind and clear your mind. Whether it’s by yourself, or with family and friends, this is a place to check out if you’re in the area. It’s a hidden gem.

Peace Valley has been the park I go to with friends and family as long as I can remember. The trails are well kept and the bike path is clean. I have always loved coming here and I am sure that won't change anytime soon.

name: Drumthwacket Foundation
address: 354 Stockton St, Princeton, NJ 08540, USA
reviews:
The Holidays at Drumthwacket 2019 are the Best!!  Please go online and register for free tickets.  Every year, the talented members of the New Jersey Garden Cub decorate using fresh arrangements and greenery that compliment the architecture and decor of each public room....truly amazing!
This year the chef prepared crumb cake and ginger snaps accompanied by mulled NJ apple cider and hot chocolate...way delicious!!  I belong to the Allentown Garden Club and we decorated the Governor's Study...make sure you visit this outstanding room.

Beautiful grounds with extremely friendly staff and the troopers on site were extremely friendly. Really enjoyed my tour throughout the house. I look forward to becoming the next Governor of New Jersey and moving in here someday!
Fantastic tour and  history if you are ever invited.
Beautiful historic site for sitting NJ Governor to use.  Enjoy Christmas decor the most here.  Fireplace is like a scene from Scrooge.
I like that place good for family n friends. Princeton shops close by.

name: Fonthill Castle
address: 525 E Court St, Doylestown, PA 18901, USA
reviews: Everyone from the moment I entered was super friendly and knowledgeable. My tour guide whose name sadly escapes me now was amazing. I was fortunate enough to get a one on one tour as it was a weekday afternoon but I had a blast. Seeing the castle and understanding more about Mercer's legacy was really awesome. Had no idea the castle even was here in PA but glad I stumbled across it in my travels. Thanks again to everyone who made my experience fantastic. Highly recommended!

My interior design class took a trip here and the Moravian tile factory. It was definitely worth the drive and everything and every room was beautiful. One of the first rooms we walked into opened up with a beautifully tiled ceiling. It was absolutely amazing

The castle was so cool! We loved it. Our tour guide and the entire staff was very knowledgeable as well. I don't want to spoil the looks of the castle but it definitely is a must-see for a great price. The tour lasted for around an hour to an hour and a half. The only suggestion I will make is that there really should be a minimum age requirement. There were a couple of very young toddlers in our tour group which was very distracting, and they were running around and crashing into displays. It really is not a safe environment for young children or for the castle itself, as children like to play around and touch things. Other than that, its an awesome trip!
Fonthill Castle was very interesting. I did not know much about Mercer before going here. The tile work on display was fabulous. The type of the castle was great too.

What a terrific experience! Fonthill castle is an amazing place with tons of history. The tour cost was very affordable and the tour was so good! Our tour guide Kevin was so knowledgeable and friendly! I highly recommend taking the tour!

name: Battleship New Jersey
address: 100 Clinton St, Camden, NJ 08103, USA
reviews: This place is amazing. We went on a self guided tour and it took us 4 hours to complete. The ship is very well maintained and is so rich in history. I loved climbing through to different areas and seeing different things round every corner. My personal favorites were the barber shop, brig, dental and surgery area. The staff was incredibly kind and helpful. The gift shop is awesome as well. I can't wait to go back.

My son and I went with the cub Scouts and had a great time.  What a magical experience.  The staff was excellent, without exception.  Knowledgeable and willing and excited to answer every question a six/seven/eight year old had to ask.  The faces while we had a guided tour were awesome.  Both kids and adults.  I would not hesitate to go back.

It is a great historical place to visit. Layer out very well. Self guides your gives you the opportunity to look at things more than once. Plenty of seats along the way ... it is a long walk ,Just a  Heads up.  Pretty cool to stand in places the Admiral stood and to see Admiral's, Captains quarters, Crew quarters and gun turrets and Helicopter. ... Well done Crew!

I had a pleasing experience. Love the history that was presented on my self guided tour. Not too crowded when I went. Wish I had more time to explore more of the ship. Noticed there was even a little kids section which was cute. I was only able to see one level of the ship but the experience was great.

I enjoyed my visit to this historic ship. Very friendly helpful staff, lots to see and great views from the ship too. A must see for history buffs or anyone wanting a window in to a different era. Able to enter many parts of the ship including the gun turrets. Thankful to have lived in a time where my military service was un needed. Being in those turrets in the heat of battle is unfathomable.

name: Reading Terminal Market
address: 51 N 12th St, Philadelphia, PA 19107, USA
reviews: Great food as always. So many varieties to select from. I cant try them at once. But you'll definitely want to. I doubt you'll see any foods that won't capture your culinary curiosity or desire. I've always found the variety of foods served their to be nothing nut delicious. Fresh baked cakes and pies courtesy of our friendly neighbors from Lancaster County, the Amish merchants providing fresh homemade recipe dishes and beverages. Their candy section makes my sweet tooth come alive. Of course you can't end a meal without ice cream. Different flavors to also satisfy your desire for sweet delights. I personally also love having a gyro or other samples of Greek foods. Domestic or international cuisine are all under one roof for you to enjoy. You'll have to see and taste what I'm talking about.

Absolutely love this gem of Philadelphia. The Cajun sandwiches are a must try. The one with steak, pepperoni and cheeses amazing. We also tried the alligator sausage, which was a bit lighter than the steak and cheese. I’d recommend getting both and trying half of each.

The produce section has incredible prices and love the selection of fresh fruits and dried fruits. 

It can be tough to get seating especially during peak times. Just keep your eye out and know you might have to share a small table with strangers. If the weather is nice, there’s plenty of nearby seating if you take a walk outside. 

Also there are multiple bathroom stalls in the back and in my experience they’ve always been clean. Fill up your water bottle at the water fountain next to the bathrooms to avoid spending $2-3 on water.

This place is wonderful! As soon as you walk in the smell of the different foods makes you want to eat everything. Always busy but a very friendly atmosphere. Also the staff is very helpful and will take the time to actually walk you to a specific shop that you're looking for.

Wow! This place has it all when it comes to choices of places to eat and drink. If you cannot find anything you like here, you are not trying! If anything, there is too many choices. Wonderful place to visit and enjoy. A visit to Philly should include stopping here often. Open for breakfast, lunch and dinner, though if convention going on, lines for lunch are out the door! My favorite place to go when in town for a convention,  it is just across the street!

I visited Bee Natural a boutique if the sorts that offers handmade/homemade candles, lip balms, hand creams and a variety of all natural bee wax products. They must have at least 15-20 different lip balms in flavors like green tea, pumpkin, pizza, vanilla lavender, currants, peppermint and so many more. They are only $2.50 each which makes you want to grab a couple of different scents. The glide on smooth without any waxy residue which is nice. The also have lovely hand-carved honeycomb candles reasonable price that make great gifts.

name: Working Dog Winery
address: 610 Windsor Perrineville Rd, Robbinsville Twp, NJ 08691, USA
reviews: Great place!. The staff is great, the wine is great, and they allow dogs! 🐾 We did a wine tasting which was only $7 per person and we each got to try 5 different wines. The prices for the bottles are not bad either, we got a bottle for $17. They also allow you to bring snacks but no drinks which is fine because they sell bottled water for only $1. The staff here is very nice, friendly, and helpful. They have indoor and outdoor seating and they have water bowls available for the doggies. A great place to come with friends, family, or a date.
Views on views. A great place to sample and try local wines. You can bring your own food in a picnic basket.
Very nice winery especially if you want to bring your dog.
Live this place..great atmosphere...great wine and really a great staff!!! Mark and host crew do an awesome job!!!!

I love dog friendly venues! The wines were delicious and the staff friendly. It was busy while we were there but the lines and tastings went quickly. They don't allow the dogs to bark inside which is nice!

name: Mercer Museum
address: 84 S Pine St, Doylestown, PA 18901, USA
reviews: Very interesting mix of old tools and craftsman implements.  Would be even better if more explanation provided as to how the tools were actually used.  And, we visited on a 40 degree F day, so it was about 45 F throughout the museum!  Worthwhile visit, though!

Visited for a Christmas program. Many interesting exhibits on display. The museum has an eerie feel to it. It literally transports you to another era of old and antiques. Lots of hidden turns and staircases. One visit is not enough to take it all in.

The best most interesting museum, especially to bring children. Children can run free, there's a lot of children's activities and there is something interesting in every nook and cranny, like the vampire killing kit, for when you traveled to Eastern Europe.  Yes, it's real. Always can  learn something new there.

This is an amazing place. The entire building is concrete and I mean everything right down to the little dividers on the window panes! Built.in 1913-1915, 40 men and a 5hp cement mixer! It has 7 floors and houses a beautiful collecting of antique tools!

Whacky, interesting, historical, well laid out.
A lot of money has obviously been spent on this Museum! Worth a visit.
One tip though - the main building is not heated and old and kinda drafty, so wrap up warm if you're going in the winter!

name: Glencairn Museum
address: 1001 Cathedral Rd #0757, Bryn Athyn, PA 19009, USA
reviews: Simply put, it's one of the most beautiful places that I have ever seen. Open to the public with a friendly staff, I never felt awkward taking a peek inside. This is a religious setting and proper respect is due, but that doesn't mean you can't enjoy the grounds and the museum. This place always fills me with a sense of peace and spirituality.

I recently went here for the Nativity presentation with my family. This Christmastime event has a wonderful display of beautiful Nativity scenes created all around the world. 

We have also been here for the museum tour a couple times. I found it to be one of the most fascinating tours of a historic homes of any I have been in.

THIS MUSEUM IS SPECTACULAR. CANNOT FULLY ENJOY IT IN ONE VISIT. THE GUIDES. KNOW THEIR STUFF, THERE WAS NO FUMBLING FOR WORDS. DEFINITELY HAVE TO GO BACK ! EVERYONE SHOULD VISIT THIS MUSEUM. I ENJOYED IT.
Great Christmas exhibit. The castle was beautifully decorated. The history and nativity scenes were interesting. I made a day of it and also toured the manor house and the nearby cathedral

This home was truly a beautiful palace/ church. Would have liked to see more rooms of the home. Have been here twice in hopes of seen different rooms of this home and they showed the same rooms for 2 different tours...🤷🏻‍♀️

name: Black River & Western Railroad
address: 245 John Ringo Rd, Ringoes, NJ 08551, USA
reviews: It was really a amazing place. They run steam and diesel so make sure you check the site before going. The ride is about and hour and 20 minutes round trip.
