One was is about 23-26 minutes with a short layover in the middle that is 15-20 minutes. It is a great place with friendly staff, great heritage equipment, and tranports you back in time. I would recommend this to any train lover or person who likes a good day out.

Good place to ride 100 years old train. However keep in mind that steam engine is not running every weekend,  and even on the days it is scheduled to be, not necessarily you will ride steam but not diesel (also kind of historical,  but not steam). Additionally, as both engines are old, there are possibly of delays. We had a delay for about 25 minutes as they had issue connecting the engine to the cars. Besides that- it is worth if every penny spent. Nice 30 minutes (one way) ride (you are paying for the round trip though). Conductors will tell you a history of this railroad and the cars. Good views. Ringoes has a gift shop and a small in-car museim and a restroom. My family was very pleased with this trip. BTW, for those with small kids - during Christmas time they are running polar express.

Fun family-friendly train ride during the holidays. Tickets include the out-and-back ride (~12 miles total) on historic trains, hot cocoa, cookie, mini-museum, and Santa photo (check beforehand, as Santa isn't there all days). Train cars have antique wood burning stove heaters.
The train ride was fun and the museum was pretty interesting, kids will love this place.
This was a fun train ride for the whole family! It was extra special since Santa and his elves were roaming the train the whole time! This will be a Christmas time tradition for my family.

name: Howling Woods Farm
address: 1371 W Veterans Hwy, Jackson Township, NJ 08527, USA
reviews:
I WOLF this place! 🐺What a beautiful preservation with majestic creatures. Wild experience to see the  life size portions of these animals. The guides are knowledgeable and plentiful to pay attention to the wolves and groups. 

To have the ability to pet these wonderful animals is something else. Worth the visit. Glad to know wonderful places like this exist for the welfare of these animals and also the education of the public. 

No big bad wolves here.

This was one of the most amazing experiences. I’m so happy I found this place. If you’re debating on going, just do it. You won’t regret it. Tina was absolutely amazing and she was so good with the wolves and knew exactly what she was talking about. Can’t wait to go back and volunteer ❤️ Thank you!!
First time experience was awesome with the interactions! Going from pin to pin, playing and even learning about different types of wolves. Highly recommended!

We visited with family. This is a great place with dedicated people that helps educate the public. Highly recommended as it is both a wonderful experience and an informative presentation. All of the animals are very smart and a pure joy to be around.

This place is a Wolf Sanctuary, over here they have different session for them being that they cant all be together. It was a really cool experience to learn so much about them, how they live, think, and how amazing they’re. Definitely some of the most amazing and smartest creatures on earth. Samson the old guy was so adorable despite earning his name after ripping a door in half, pretty much when they’re eating their pray, the only part they don’t eat is the Jaw, other than that they chew on every single other bone, they’re compassionate and loving towards little ones, and care for them. Our group guide was amazing, informative and passionate about it, however we found out at the end that it was his first presentation, which we couldn’t believe. It kinda stared raining at some point, so they kindly let me use a spare jacket they had, they also go by a suggested $20 donation, which is not bad at all, they have a gift shop as well. Glad to see so many beauties rescued. Btw some of them are mixed and adoptable.

name: Philadelphia Zoo
address: 3400 W Girard Ave, Philadelphia, PA 19104, USA
reviews: Went to this place with my sister and nephew in the beginning of March.The zoo was beautiful and really enjoyed the wrap around tunnel cages that go overhead. Some of the animals were not out considering the time of year but would definitely recommend as a great family place to bring you children. Would love to see some elephants in the future and maybe a nocturnal animal exhibit.

I really enjoy this zoo.  My wife and i are from Baltimore and we would rather go to the Philadelphia Zoo instead of the one here.  It feel a lot safer, it definitely cleaner and has ample, easy to find bathrooms.  I have been to the Philadelphia zoo many times; many exhibits are the same, but some have changed.  Very enjoyable experience.

Literally one of my favorite places in Philly. I buy a season pass every year. The staff is PHENOMENAL, especially considering my youngest sister is handicapped. Staff is knowledgeable,friendly,and patient. The exhibits are beautiful and the zoo is clean. So many fun activities to do and secret quiet areas for when we need to take a minute. I suggest everyone not only visit Philadelphia zoo, but to take it all in as the wonderful experience it is.

Was pretty good but like any other zoo you don't see a lot of animals! They have their moments! Both kids enjoyed the indoor / outdoor learning adventure! Weather was mild for Philadelphia winter 50F degree

One of the best Zoo which is located in Philadelphia, United States. The Zoo where we can see varieties of Animals. And covered with Plants & Trees. Quite love watching & observing the Animals. Full enjoyment & truly it is like Adventure. Recommended to visit!

name: Rozmaryn
address: 925 N Olden Ave, Trenton, NJ 08638, USA
reviews: What a little gem in the heart of Trenton. Stormy night, dining room to ourselves -- wonderful homemade Polish delicacies -- fresh, abundant, and so flavorful! One of the best values around. So glad to have finally tried it out. We'll be back!
Love this place!  Delicious, authentic food, friendly service, great prices.  So far, it's a hidden gem.

Our family and friends were in town for an event and looking for a Polish restaurant to visit as a small group on the weekend. We were so fortunate to find Rozmaryn!

We ended up reserving the table near the front of the restaurant, which was perfect. The food was so warm and welcoming--just like my grandmother used to make. We brought some Polish beers from across the street. Service was wonderful; our server was proactive and considerate, even though they were short on staff that day.

I'm so sad that I don't pass through town more often! Am hoping to make plans to return someday.
Awesome homemade food no frills just fabulous cooking !
hidden great polish resturant with the best polish dumplings!!! try the cabbage piergos, cheese and potatoe and ask for bacon and sour cream you'll thank me

name: Blue Danube Restaurant
address: 538 Adeline St, Trenton, NJ 08611, USA
reviews: Very nice old memorabilia. The food is always delicious. EVERYTHING is made fresh for everyone's desire. Give them a try.  But parking is mainly on the street.
Always a great meal. If you want to go back in time, and have a good home cooked meal, this is it. Old world charm and food like grandma used to make. Take an hour or two, and take some friends!

Very good!  My husband and I went for lunch.   The food was great and the service was excellent.   I had the stuffed cabbage and pierogies and my husband had beef goulash which were both very tasty.   We have been here before, but what I like is that the food is consistently good.
Love this place!  Always a great meal.  And the staff treats you like family!

Quite a cozy place. Looks like it used to be a large house. Instead of a bunch of lettuce and a few tomatoes,  the house salad was great! All of the vegetables were evenly mixed, if I had know the salad was like that, I would have ordered a large one. I had the seafood with pasta mild, and it was delicious

name: Enzo's La Piccola Cucina
address: 1906 Princeton Ave, Lawrence Township, NJ 08648, USA
reviews: There are no words to describe the amazing aroma, that lingers by the front. The meals did not disappoint! From veal to seafood all we ordered was perfect. I only wish I remembered to take a picture before I ate.  Small alfresco patio. Don't drive by too fast, you might miss it.

Went to Enzo's the other night with my wife and her friend and we had a great time. I had an all meat pizza and it was great. Even thought it's a tight small restaurant it's quite quaint as restaurant. Also the staff are very nice and helpful.
Amazing food and service.  Came here with my brother and his wife.  They also enjoyed the food.  Will be back again.
The food, atmosphere, and service where the best around.  My only problem was not having a big enough stomach to eat more. Truly wonderful food.
Always delicious, homemade meals. My favorite kitchen after my own.

name: Malaga
address: 511 Lalor St, Hamilton Township, NJ 08611, USA
reviews: Lovely place to dine with family or a romantic date.  Authentic Spanish cuisine where everything is made from scratch! Seafood is always fresh and the staff is professional and polite! The restaurant has a cozy intimate vibe but on busy days, this translates to crowded. The sangria is delicious and I recommend you purchase by the pitcher because you'll want another glass!

More a birthday celebration than romantic dinner spot. Fun guitar and singing, candles in some yummy rice pudding for both events. A bit noisy and the only two-seat tables face the kitchen doors. Attentive serving staff, will likely upgrade your request for a glass of sangria into pitcher. Beware: Potent potables. Steak and shellfish--delicious. Duck--eh. Easy, well lit parking. The bar is quieter than dining room. Worth another visit.
I've been eating here for over 30 years...I never had a bad meal.. the best food in NJ..  hands down!! The best service in the industry... love this place:)

I really enjoy this place food is really good staff is very friendly. Red sangria is great 
I ordered a rack of lamb with vegetables and rice that was really good.
I would like to make a reservation next time to see The flamingo dancers second Sunday of every month $12 cover charge

All in all, a good dinning experience. Plenty of menu choices, good service and a pleasant atmosphere. Except for the overcooked vegetables, the veal I ordered was excellent. The seafood appetizers were delicious and the Gazpacho very tangy.

name: Savory Leaf Cafe
address: 960 Spruce St, Lawrence Township, NJ 08648, USA
reviews: So happy to see a plant based option for those of us non meat eaters at the Trenton Farmers Market.   The family was wonderful and the food looked amazing. Plant based people - it's the way to go. Unless of course you prefer illness and obesity. Time we educate ourselves. - Read Forks Over Knives.  Wake up America!

I really enjoyed the famous cheese steak. Born and raised in Philly I had lived near a Pat´s on 33rd and Ridge Ave. The wait for my order was a bit long but the place was packed. My sandwich came and it was nice and hot and tasty. I will be going back very soon.

Reuben sandwich is amazing. It is like tasting a real Reuben. 
The Cuban has a great taste and reminded me of those Cuban sandwiches I had at El Palmar un Elizabeth NJ. 

Now as for the Mac and Cheese. This has been the only vegan Mac and Cheese that tastes like a Mac and Cheese. 

This restaurant is "to the nines".

Great food and great staff. They will accommodate you in any way they can. I’ve been looking for a vegan spot that sells impossible meat. Now I’ve found it and it’s not all the way in California. Thanks guys.

Tried the Impossible burger and vegetable soup. Both were excellent. The soup was clearly "home made" and the burger tasted just like meat as far as I could tell! Friendly service, and an interesting menu so we'll surely be back.

name: Hummingbird
address: 29 S Warren St, Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews: When I first started going to this place. Everything was good. Ever since they changed management and added the older lady with glasses. My service has been terrible.  She charges me 50 cents for a small cup of hot sauce that's barely a quarter inch filled. Then on top of that, she doesn't respectfully greet me. Now I'm a black businessman myself, so I know how hard it is for us as a people to support one another. But I am one of those who supports their own. If I spend my money somewhere I expect to be treated with respect & valued as the loyal customer I am. So with that said, they have to do better...
Hummingbird takeout is requested by my family every time I'm in Trenton. Fantastic, always consistent food & a great staff. Definitely a must try.
Authentic. Delicious, fresh generous portions. A gem in the middle of downtown. Clean prompt friendly service.  Cheerful decor. You won't be disappointed!

Great food!! I have a Jamaican Restaurant near me and I went 2x and the food was horrible. Kept seeing the Hummingbird and decided to try it and I was so not disappointed. My goof the flavor and the portion size was amazing. I will be back 😁😊☺️
Tried stewed chicken with white rice & cabbage. I wasn't pleased at all, the chicken left a nasty after taste in my mouth & the rice is super gummy & the cabbage was hardly seasoned.

name: Cafe Antonio
address: 107 E Trenton Ave, Morrisville, PA 19067, USA
reviews:
Went for Happy Hour here after being told it was nice during a conversation. I was pleasantly surprised by the atmosphere, imagining it to mostly be like drinking in a pizza shop. 
They do indeed have a pizza shop which looked as though it had much to offer on its menu boards.
But I sat at the bar in the restaurant.
I ordered a Cosmopolitan and it was done perfectly, and is part of the happy hour drink specials. 
For food, I tried the nachos which were excellent. The toppings were all nicely blended and melted together with.the cheese, and not just an assortment of ingredients piled on chips.
Service was Very friendly and welcoming.
I had a look at the main menu and must say it is quite extensive with very reasonable prices.
I look forward to returning for a dinner experience soon!
I recommend Cafe Antonio's highly

Cafe Antonio's has definitely made some major upgrades from 15 years ago!!! 👍🏾
Most places don't reinvest in their facility, but not here!!! My wife and I talked about how Tony has always had big visions for his restaurant and he has done it... And the food is excellent too! Check out these photos. 😇💯👍🏾

Was looking for a Friday night happy hour bar for food and drink. Cafe Antonio fits the bill. Great selection of tsp beer. Happy hour menu was small. But I had a pizza that was very good for $8.50. Would recommend
We’ve been enjoying the cafe for almost fifteen years now. We recently found out there has been a change in ownership. We’re open to see where the future will take this longtime favorite.
Cute place. Italian music was a treat. Salmon was amazing. Veal was a little too thick for some people in our party. Ravioli were perfect. Would definitely recommend.

name: NJWeedman's Joint
address: 322 E State St, Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews: Great food great prices. The spiritual atmosphere is relaxing and inviting. Staff is friendly and informative. It was my first time but it won't be my last. Don't miss out on the good food and great times!

The food is cooked with love and you can taste it in every bite. We were greeted with a smile and everyone there was happy to see us. For our first time there, we were treated as if we were there daily for years. The smell upon walking in is Devine. The menu is large and the items are cleverly named. Do yourself a favor and grab some grub from this joint. It will do your belly and soul some good and everyone needs that. It will love you back.
This place is awesome. Chicken cheese steak was amazing, hot, fresh and tasty. Great atmosphere, great friendly people. Laid back, positive vibes. We will be back.
Very good people and Weedman is very niceman. Street is getting gas pipe replaced making State street safest ever for gas related incidents!

I had been wanting to go here since I heard of it a few years back and finally my friend and I made a time to go.
 The food was simple but really good and fresh, the cook and staff were all really pleasant. As were the other patrons we encountered. It strikes me as a community hub, which is always nice to see. 
They were about to introduce shrimp poor boys to the menu the afternoon we were there. Multiple people came in asking when they would be available, quite a buzz about them lol, I will definitely be ordering them the next time.

name: The Big Easy of Trenton Restaurant
address: 111 S Warren St, Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews:
The Best Soul Food around!!!
End and out in a timely fashion.
Definitely going back 💯💯

Delicious food, relaxed atmosphere, friendly service. Very reasonably priced: Paid around $26 (inc tip) for a nicely cooked rib eye steak, 2 sides and a drink. Would definitely eat here again whenever I'm in the area.

The food is great.  It's like down home cooking.  I would have rated it five stars, but the prices are a little bit high.  A meal with a drink is about $12+ and unfortunately, this means I can't eat there as often as I would like to.  The staff are friendly and the seating is good; although it's a bit cold near the doors and windows.  It was also just a little too dark near the counter.  I would have liked a little more lighting.

OMG....I cant say enough.  THANK YOU!!!!  Great supporting local businesses. Customer service was outstanding and food was perfect quality. And price point was perfect for what we needed. Food was read on time and you have a life long customer. This is truly a shining star of Trenton. When you are at work or just passing through...try it. Everything was made to order and was FRESH!!!!!! YOU COULD TASTE THE LOVE IN EVERYTHING.

I went during lunch time around noon. I ordered the Mac n cheese, string beans,collard greens  and ox-tail. For 2 sides and 1 meat $15.
Pros - 
1. waitress was polite and attentive 
2.Restaurant decor is very nice
3.Great music playing 
4.Location is convenient 
5.Was decently priced given the location and portion size 
6.Ox-tail was tender. Sauce had a nice flavor 
Cons-
1.My least favorite dish was the Mac n cheese.the cheese used did not give the taste a kick. Didn't really taste seasoned. 
2.The string beans didn't have much flavor either. The collard greens were okay. 
3.Potato salad was offered as a menu item but the waitress informed us that there was no more .Before offering the menu items, items should be verified. 
I decided to try this restaurant because it was suggested to me. I was disappointed because as a soul food restaurant Mac n cheese and collard greens should be on point. When you grow up on soul food, you become a tough critic lol 
I would visit again to try 
something else.

name: 1911 Smokehouse BBQ
address: 11 W Front St, Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews: Great food and drinks! Try the special beers on tap, with a large selection of top shelf alcohol. Always a mixed crowd of great people. Great music and you can always watch the game. First Fridays are the best, summer block parties with live entertainment and DJ's. Dancing in the street is so much fun.Outside cigar area in the back with large theater screen! The Honey Harlem Shake wings are my favorite. Ohhhh! By the way park on the street or in the parking garage,which is free on the weekends. Do Not Park in the parking lot near the restaurant. The owner of the parking lot will tow your car.

Highly Recommend! We used 1911 Smokehouse for a Retirement Party and the food was delicious and price was perfect. The fried chicken/rib combo was moist and flavorful; baked beans were deliciously seasoned with pineapple chunks baked in; breaded mushrooms were finished first, corn was perfectly seasoned, and to top it off the cookie tray was a perfect dessert. The owner Reggie was easy to work with and always professional. I would definitely use this business again.

This place is my number one place.  Of all restaurants I know I like it most. I always suggests to my friends to go to this restaurant. Whenever  I want to go to a good supper, this place comes straightaway to my mind. extremely good and   food and a rich cuisine.trained staff members, and agreeable atmosphere. And very important, the charge is decent. I suggest this restaurant with great pleasure.

[Covid-19 time period] Had been wanting to try this spot for a long time and really glad we finally did.  We had the 1/2 chicken and rib combo and it was amazing.  Got beans and mac & cheese sides.  M&C was cheesy, beans were excellent.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Pro tip: the bbq is mainly dry rub, so if you like it "wet", don't hesitate to order some extra sauce.  Their sauces are amazing, btw! Ribs and chicken were both cooked to perfection.

The food is ok....
The service and the atmosphere are great.
Their staff is awesome. Clean and organize!!

name: Health Is Wealth Vegetarian/Vegan Restaurant & Juicebar
address: 242 E State St, Trenton, NJ 08611, USA
reviews:
I got the lemon ricotta pancakes, turkey sausage, eggs and garlic potatoes. So good. The pancakes were such a big win and the turkey sausage was amazing as well. This place is much smaller then I thought. Make sure to reserve a spot on yelp.

We also got the chicken, rice and egg dish. It wasn't a stand out for me, but we did enjoy it. Chicken was well done, rice was a bit bland for my taste.

Food is delicious but service and portions can be improved. Not sure why there's a kid taking my order each time. Basic things like eye contact, greetings, and thanks yous were non-existent. Also, the picture of the food shown was part of the Taste of Trenton menu in June. What you see is two "dishes", each $5. Not sure how this small amount of food was $10.

Yummy healthy food. I would give a 5 star but they do take some tome to prepare the food. If you have 30min lunch breaks like me you are going to be late for work. Next time I will be sure to call it in first then pick it up
Awesome spot He the owner has made a vegan dish I sent him a picture of. That is awesome service the food is amazing.
Food was well worth the wait. Place is very chill. Love the atmosphere and not too pricey either

name: Ila Mae's Restaurant
address: 313 Market St, Trenton, NJ 08611, USA
reviews:
Great food!!! Well prepared. Clean restaurant. Friendly staff. Fair prices. Generous servings. Fast service. 
They also have an African store that sells dashikis (made in Taiwan, go figure 😂), other articles of clothing, and soaps, body butters, jewelery items and other things.
I had a great meal. I ate it in a relaxing environment while pulling over from a long day of driving. I got a hot dashiki for $10!
Sounds like a bunch of wins is you ask me. 
Whether you're passing through on a road trip like I was, or you're a local, definitely check them out please.

AMAZING food. Smaller space adds to its warm and welcoming atmosphere. I suggest you call and order ahead as they do tend to be busy. But the food and service is amazing. I love it and highly recommend them.
Wonderful food , amazing atmosphere , clean comfortable , Breakfast lunch and dinner , black owned 💕 platters are big as well....

I've been going pretty consistently now for the past couple months about every two to three weeks. I ordered a dish on Friday called the Nairobi it supposed to have salmon, cauliflower, carrots, broccoli, cheese sauce, and potatoes there were barely any carrots and there were absolutely no potatoes... I don't like that they're already slow don't rush my food and mess it up. There were a couple instances of things I didn't like but I don't feel like putting all that down but this was the most recent incident...

I was looking for a restaurant to grab dinner before attending a graduation ceremony at the nearby Cure Arena and I came across this spot. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner and have an extensive menu of entrée, sandwich, sides and dessert soul food options (many of which have creative names) that are all full of flavor. The prices are reasonable, portions are generous and they provide fast, friendly service . The restaurant has a warm and homey décor and the counter staff was friendly. Parking is on the street.

name: Trentini's
address: 635 S Clinton Ave, Trenton, NJ 08611, USA
reviews: Fantastic environment and super attentive service. The meals were fresh and enchanting. Will easily recommend this spot to friends. Convenient rates and generous portions. Great work.
Called for pickup right before they were supposed to close, made my order in less than 15 minutes. Excellent food, excellent service. Only pizzeria I eat at in Trenton

Slow and horrible service. The lady in the front always has an attitude. Only came here because Jerry's pizza burnt down. Can't wait for them to open back up. Jerry's food is way better and they are much more respectful to customers.
Customer service is great. Very clean family vibe.. prices are gteat
Big portions, varied menu, good sevice. What you would expect from an Italian restaurant

name: Bamboo Grill Jamaican Restaurant
address: 1005 Chambers St, Trenton, NJ 08611, USA
reviews: Good food! Friendly staff!! Best Jamaican food I’ve had on the east coast!! Had to eat it two days in a row!

This place was recommended to me by someone who's never been here before! So since I was in the area I decided why not, I'll try them! I called ahead like the ratings suggested. Well I still waited for the food, no biggie right!! The lovely young lady that took my order was very nice in the phone and in person(I can't say that much for the heavy set young man at all). So that made the fact I was waiting ok. I get back to where I was to eat..... 1st. They only give me four very dry, and cold plantains with the meat combo (it's a large with two choices of meat) 2nd. The cabbage was very very hard not steamed just cut and served. Now I like a little crunch to my cabbage but this was just raw cabbage. 3rd. I got one piece of jerk chicken, it was very flavorful and cold. 4th. I got Curry goat also cold. I was only 5 minutes away from where I was going so no way after I waited and the 5 minutes drive should it have been cold! I thought the price was good for what I ordered, the service (from the young lady) was good, but the food should've been warmer, and cooked just a little longer (just the cabbage) and just maybe, no not maybe more chicken. Overall I'd give them another try to redeem themselves. This restaurant doesn't have a eat in setting it's small, but seems to be very clean. I suggest ordering ahead. Parking is street parking.
Great food, anything you get is great but be mindful to call ahead as they sometimes don't have your first or second choice.
Food is excellent. Especially the ox tail. Love love love their food
Friendly staff,  quick,  food was excellent.

name: Gyro Express
address: 7 E State St, Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews: Excellent "hole in the wall".  Generous portions that are fresh and delicious for an excellent price.  Staff are friendly and work hard to get your order done fast.  One of the  best places to pickup lunch in Trenton.  May want to plan to take out as not much room to sit and can get crowded inside with all the customers.

Amazing polite and courteous staff.
Excellent quick service.
Food is tasted very fresh and yummy. 
Though Cash only
Very reasonably priced menu. 
I would say best Halal food in the area! In fact best in NJ!

This is a great place to grab a quick bite.  They give your very generous portions and they are very reasonably priced.  As I have read in many other posts, the staff is super friendly and helpful.  If you wanted to try some different things this is the place to go.  Lamb and Chicken with many different spices and tasty vegetarian choices.  Even if you are not an adventurous eater just let them know what you like and they will put something together for you.
the best lamb gyro, always get it with white sauce, bbq and hot suace best combo!
Best Chicken Gyro i've ever had. The owner takes great pride and meticulous detail on every order. Really great lunch spot!

name: Guaterico Deli
address: 526 S Clinton Ave, Trenton, NJ 08611, USA
reviews: Excellent 👍😊👌

I ordered delivery for tacos and they said about 40 to 55 minutes so we waited, after the time passed we called to see if they were on their way because it had been past an hour now so they said he is already on his way so we waited. Then they took another hour and we called to cancel the order. They said the person just left, so they basically lied and then they were rude enough to Hang up the phone. Don’t order from this place! They are rude people and not responsible.
Great food, cheap...really cheap and it tastes great..
Great tacos good svc reasonable prices
Best 5 dollar steak in da hood bishhhh😂😂😂😂

name: La Cabaña Tica "The Bakeshop & Restaurant"
address: 3 Dayton St, Trenton, NJ 08610, USA
reviews: Excellent. Authentic. Very nice people!
Excellent,  friendly, attentive service. Food was delicious and fresh. Best home made tortillas we have ever had. I saw it reviewed by NPR and had to try it. The setting is simple and quaint.
Nice little place.  Clean, with cheery natural lighting. Friendly staff and customers. Had a mofongo and it was tasty. Will be going back for sure.

Some of the best mofongo I've had in the city. They have a plantain burger and that also was delicious. Order the quesadillas, you will not be disappointed. It's a very low key place, hidden front the main road, with attached parking.
Great place to eat authentic latin food specially costa rican. Also BYOB. Pastries and coffee.

name: Sabor Latino
address: 293 Ashmore Ave, Trenton, NJ 08611, USA
reviews: The food was very good.  Had a few items from the menu and everything was delicious.
I had to trash the food. It was overcooked and over seasoned! The meat tasted old

This past weekend I was able to celebrate my birthday at Sabor Latino and I was so happy I did. I always dine in and order out from this restaurant cause the food is amazing ! This weekend i decided to stay for the after hours and invite some friends over to enjoy the food and lounge area. After 10pm they have great DJs and and the atmosphere is really dope. The manager made sure everything was set up and going just how I wanted. He reserved seats so me and all my friends  can eat together and even a section in the lounge area where we were able to dance and enjoy my birthday. The two waiter Alex and Michelle were very attentive and kind and made sure our food and drinks were exactly how we wanted. Me and my friends are always treated with respect and like family when we go there. They made sure I had a great birthday. They have the best drinks , food and music and for good price! Thank you Sabor Latino

Good service but food is not traditional. It tastes like something you with find in Cracker Barrel their version of enchilada verde is rotisserie chicken in tortillas with chicken gravy poured on top! The costarican rice tasted like Chinese food and was full of chicken fat (see picture below). I would not recommend. We came here a few years ago and it was good but since there’s a new cook it’s really bad.
Great food! Locals eat here. Service could be more attentive. We waited 15 minutes after meal and literally have to wave someone to get our check.

name: Chencha y Chole
address: 865 S Broad St, Trenton, NJ 08611, USA
reviews: This is authentic Mexican at it's best.  Delicious choices, fair pricing and large portions.   Pro tip: you can order to-go at the counter or sit down for full service. We were a little confused at first as it appeared like you order at the counter and they bring out the food.  The sopes are amazing and I had chicken rellenos which was to die for.  This is our new favorite Mexican spot in the area.

While visiting all the way from Kentucky, I was with a group on a visit to the University of Princeton and this was the planned food stop on our itinerary. Now being that it was a Mexican restaurant, I came in with some pretty lofty expectations. Yet, I think those expectations were fulfilled and then some. The service was very good and the food was an equal match. I definitely would visit again if I;m ever in town.
Excellent service. Great staff. Food was incredible. I got the shrimp turkey burger combo. I would definitely recommend this to anyone in town.
Looks like it's family owned, the food is good, reasonably priced, The servers were helpful, I only wish my Spanish speaking skills were better.
Awesome Al Pastor tacos and great tamales!!!  One of my favorites in the Trenton area!!!

name: Pho Friendly Vietnamese Cuisine
address: 729 Brunswick Ave, Trenton, NJ 08638, USA
reviews: The lady is very friendly. Everything is delicious. big portion too. I forgot to take a picture until I am almost done with the soup pho. Very good broth.
Very good place to eat. Huge portions. We couldn't finish all. Steamed dumplings yummy. Must try.

This is a very underrated place. me and a friend of mine came here on Saturday morning and had the vegetarian Pho and green curry. the food was amazing and absolutely satisfying the staff was very accommodating and friendly. I highly recommend you come here it's a very family-like establishment and the food is very very very good. We ended our meal with Vietnamese hot coffee. We will be coming here more often.

Incredible food in a small cozy atmosphere
Lee is a gem, highly recommend the tofu and vegetable curry panang.
We were looking for Thai restaurant, found this. I tried pho. It was OK to me. I do not know actual taste of pho. But certainly, I will not try pho in any Thai or Vietnamese restaurant.

name: Leonardo's
address: 2021 Brunswick Ave, Lawrence Township, NJ 08648, USA
reviews: Elegant, delicious, friendly, amazing atmosphere - can't say enough good. It is so good that I almost don't want to share a review! everything here will exceed your expectations.
Awesome food, amazing service! Rob and Magda run a fantastic place to eat. Enjoy!!

Perfect cozy place with nice ambience. Lots of vegetarian options on the menu and willing to accomodate customizations. However, being a vegetarian i could smell lot of seafood throughout the dining time coming from the kitchen and also pungent in the glassware which made it an unpleasant experience.
Huge portions. Great service. BYOB or by a bottle or half bottle from a local vineyard. Huge menu. Lots of great things to pick from

Great Italian place, amazing portions sizes and quite the variety of appetizers and entrees. Special on this night was a Grilled Ribeye 👌. This after enjoying some broccoli rabe, amazing fried calamari and some local red wine. Cannoli's could have used some more stuffing, but great location and comfortable dining.

name: Taqueria El Mariachi
address: 109 S Olden Ave, Trenton, NJ 08609, USA
reviews: Food is delicious and prices are reasonable. They give a generous amount of food. I only give it 4 stars because the locale leaves much to be desired.
Best Mexican food in the area. Place doesn't look like much but it is excellent. Food is always consistent with quality and quantity. You will not be disappointed.
Food was amazing. While watching Dr. Disrespect.. firm hands all around

I would eat here everyday if i could. the food is delicious and fresh no matter at what time of the day you want to eat. I usually call for a pickup order and they have my food ready within 20mins. service is prompt and friendly. I've known this restaurant for over 10 years and i dont remember a time when i had a complaint.
Super friendly, prices are great and AMAZING food, I'm going back tomorrow. I recommend this place to anyone looking for really good food !

name: Best Food In Town
address: 924 Brunswick Ave, Trenton, NJ 08638, USA
reviews: The place looks like an abandoned building and the only edible thing I had was rice with vegetables. All their meals have a ton of oil in it and the one meal with meat we ordered wasn't even meat. It tasted like a shoe sole. The quality fits the location it is in. But the name "Best food in town" is far from right.
They have good food and good surface and fast and quick delivery service

The little Chinese lady that has been there for over 10 years is a little feisty but is tough-as-nails and has to be dealing with the people in that area. The food is good in my experience although it is not the busiest place
Very good food I like it

I must admit the food here is good(at least what i ordered was). The customer service on the other hand is an embarrassment. I literally placed an order of shrimp lo mein and ask for additional shrimp on the side and they refused!! I was so confused especially because I placed the exact same order the day prior. I was convinced the lady must’ve misheard me but as I tried to explain she just hung up. I called back to try and clarify, but she repeatedly just said no we don’t do that. I was truly baffled. Then it got to the point they said they had no more drivers and hung on me again! What a joke. Never ordering here again. The good food certainly is not worth the headache.

name: Covello's Pizza
address: 308 S Broad St, Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews: Great cheese steak sandwich and fries! Pizza was also yummy. Good place to eat lunch when serving on a jury. Fast service.
We thoroughly enjoyed it meal

Great food, friendly and courteous    staff. Nice family atmosphere, but the neighborhood is not neccesarily quite so family friendly. The pizza maker is a talented craftsman, and they go above and beyond to make you feel valued and welcome.
Best pizza in town
Been here a couple times. They definitely out do most pizza places. Great pizza. Haven't had anything else yet, but the pizza again is top notch.

name: Sunrise Luncheonette
address: 26 S Warren St, Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews: I love this place!  Good, simple food and the owner is wonderful.  They make everything to order so it can sometimes be slow, but have patience!
Amazing breakfast food the server is always courteous will definitely recommend to all my co-workers and Friends
Very nice low keyed place. Food is good never had to wait long. I only goes on Saturday mornings because I leave early for work during the week.
Great Food and Very Clean and Nice Area 👍
Food is delicious allow lots of time it normally takes awhile. Service is friendly and attentive. The Luncheonette is very laid back and casual

name: Frankye's
address: 1500 S Clinton Ave # 1, Trenton, NJ 08610, USA
reviews: During the day is a restaurant. I ordered tacos al pastor and they were good. After 11 PM is just a bar where people go drink and dance.
I love Franky's great food good music, great bartenders. Best service
Excellent food, fast, friendly service. Everything came out piping hot. Huge variety, reasonably priced.
Very nice place
Mostly a bar.  The restaurant is windowless, but the food is surprisingly good and extremely reasonable.  The carne adobada is some of the best you'll find in Trenton, which is saying something.

name: El Chapin Restaurant
address: 802 Lamberton St, Trenton, NJ 08611, USA
reviews: Certainly one of the best places with a reasonable prices and a good, healthy food! If I could do more stars, I would. Try half chicken platter with rice and beans and vegetables for little over $10!!! 10 Stars if possible!
Friendly staff, quite spot to chill, the food is good. My firdt visit and it won't be my last.
The food is amazing and very affordable. I order through GrubHub, and it’s always on time. I just had the best chicken burrito bowl of my life so far.
Exelent real hispanic dishes

True authentic Guatemalan cuisine. Google has it labeled as a Mexican restaurant, but it's not. The food is great i order from here at least twice a month. They have tons of selections for anyone who wants beef, pork, fish, or chicken. I would recommend this place if you happen to be in the Trenton area or just passing through. It is a small restaurant with a big hearty menu.

name: La Parrilla Steak House
address: 1007 Hamilton Ave, Trenton, NJ 08629, USA
reviews: We order from here about every Sunday. The food is pretty good. Very rarely have issues. They are very friendly and you get a lot of food. The only reason I didn’t give them 5 stars is because they don’t accept credit cards over the phone.

In the mood for flame grilled meat done Guatemalan style? This is your place.

Amazing prices! 3 people can easily be satisfied with the 3 Carnes dish.

Flame cooked beef, marinated pork and chicken. A small amount of black beans, plenty of rice, a small amount of macaroni salad, a small side salad(iceberg lettuce, cheese, tomato and onion) and plantains.

Mainly street parking but they do have a small lot.

Located on a busy street, easily located.

Small dining area with seating for ~20, friendly staff, prompt service.
Love it! Trust me get the bufflo wings with fries it's real good!

Delicious! Delicious! Delicious!  I recently enjoyed our night out at this awesome, wonderful place in Trenton! The staff was perfectly friendly & professional. I highly recommend this place. Simple atmosphere. Elegant service.

La Parrilla is a cool place for lunch or dinner, and usually not very full. Big screen TVs feature soccer games. The plates are very big and reasonably priced. Staff speak mostly Spanish, and are very friendly! Only downside is that it can sometimes be a bit of a wait. 

Definitely stop by, I can guarantee you won't be disappointed!

name: Seafood Number 1
address: 84 Pennington Ave, Trenton, NJ 08618, USA
reviews: I Love there Jumbo Shrimp. The food is very tasty..

Well, I visited after they reopened and it was not good.  The breading has clearly changed on the fish and scallops.  The breading just fell of and the fish and scallops were not thoroughly cooked.  It was a waste of time and money and my stomach was SUPER upset afterwards.  It's a shame because Trenton has no real good seafood or soul food and I was hoping this would be great and it just wasn't.
Only problem my chicken you can really taste the Salt

I got the shrimp basket with fries for $8.50 not worth that amount for 6 shrimp and a small amount of fries. The candied yams were def good. The sweet potatoe pie you can get at any cornerstore in trenton for $1.50. Super dissapointed that they have a sign with grilled shrimp , lobster and crab legs with corn but you dont offer that platter that was my whole reason for going there. First and last time there.
Fast, fresh, fried fish.

name: Cafe 609
address: 333 W State St, Trenton, NJ 08618, USA
reviews: okay so Ive never ordered from here before but this food lack every bit of soul possible. I got turkey wings! turkey wings. they gave 2 little wings and 1 not even a whole wing. them yams !!!!! yo them yams yall outta pocket for those boiled, water filled yams! and this dry rice! how I order turkey wings without no gravy where is the gravy! this food is not soul food! idk whats good there but them yams were terrible!!! and this rice is dry as all hell
Top 3 places in Trenton for some fresh food. Flavors
I love the food! Chris can cook his butt off and I love Helen who works there too. She can tell u what's on the menu and how much it cost without looking and she's pleasant to everyone.
I love this place! The food is amazing and the owners are very nice. I got my mom and my boyfriend hooked!!!

Chris and Helen are very nice people.❤❤ Cafe 609 is the place to go when you want some real good down home clean food.👍 I say "clean food" because I've never had a problem with anything I've ever ordered from them. The food is always DONE and not half cooked like some places I've been. The ONLY problem I have with my brother and sister is that THEY NEVER HAVE ANY POTATO SALAD!!! Lol😁❤ However, I will continue to support my brother Chris and my sister Helen. Excellent Customer Service!!! Great Food with a Positive Attitude!!❤❤

name: Delia’s Empanada Cafe
address: 113 S Warren St, Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews: If the City of Trenton has an award ceremony for the best-flavored restaurant, where do I place my vote? First of all, when my coworker and I  walked into Delia empanadas cafe, we where immediately HIT with the vibe, music, and compassion of the Latin culture. The establishment is clean and eccentric! I also love the fact that I can see the chefs cooking and dancing; enjoying what they do.  As a vegetarian always breaking my neck trying to find a place to cater to my taste buds, I think I finally found my spot. One word...Victoria😘

Delia's Empanada Cafe is a beautifully renovated Puerto Rican restaurant in downtown Trenton. This restaurant is located directly next to the restaurant "The Big Easy." Be aware there is no signage outside indictating the name of the restaurant at this time. They are open Monday to Friday from 9am to 4 pm. If you are looking for a wheelchair accessible option, there is one small step up to get into the restaurant but the bathroom appears accessible. The menu features a variety of items including breakfast and dessert options. Make no mistake, their empanadas are the star. We ordered 5 different types of empanadas, a shrimp mofongo dish, and 2 drinks. Our order totaled $39.00. For the amount and quality of food, I felt this was a great deal. The empanadas were large and filled generously. They were seasoned well and not greasy like other competitors. The crust is soft, flaky, and golden brown. They also came with their own homemade dipping sauce. The flavors of empanadas that we chose were shrimp, chorizo and plantain, plantain and corned beef, ground beef, and guava and cheese. The shrimp mofongo was also generous and filling with large shrimp and a bold criolla sauce. This was very well done and the shrimp was very fresh. We were served by the very charming owner Jose Pantoja who assured us that all the food was home made and everything we ate was delicious (I've have eaten out enough to know that this is not always the case). The food also came to us very quickly. We were able to complete lunch in under 40 minutes eating slowly. Although not advertised on the menu, they also offer various locally made desserts. All in all, Delia's Empanada Cafe is a great locally-owned casual lunch spot with  a reasonable price point. I wish this business the best of luck and success in the future.
Love love the food - everything is delicious - my coworkers & I eat there for lunch at least once a week!! 🥟🥘🍰🍽🥤
Food is always well flavored and tasty.  Huge variety of empanadas which are always delicious.  Small tip..harder ahead for your food because they prepare it fresh everytime.  Luv it!!!
The food here is delicious and rather well priced. Most days, during lunchtime, the line is incredibly long, so that should tell you something!

name: Po-Po Chinese Restaurant
address: 8 N Broad St, Trenton, NJ 08608, USA
reviews: One of my preferred places to eat. good location, neat, and very good customer service. I highly recommend them!
EXTREMELY rude & extremely ignorant.... ordered my food 30 min before coming n she literally ignored me for 20 min taking others orders in the store and pick ups that came way after me.
The customer service at this place is amazing. Quick service and excellent tasting food! Highly recommended!
Look Mein Beef is the best!
Food is ok..delivery service is good.although when ordering your food be sure to ask how it is prepared and it's ingredients..

name: Sunshine Restaurant
address: 901 Pennington Ave, Trenton, NJ 08618, USA
reviews:
Place has been closed for awhile. Renovations and name change taking place. As other customers stated good food, many times reheated and interior needed improvement to thrive in the current competitive environment.
Closed now for several months. Anxiously awaiting new opening.

I absolutely love this restuarant... I miss them so very much no other Jamaican restaurant beats this place when are you guys coming back I miss getting the best platters in town... I've tried other restaurants but none of them can compare to you guys at all hands down your the best
Cleanest restaurant ever.  I walk by this place nearly every weekday and the owner is cleaning the place every single day.  Fast service and the food is top notch.  Can't recommend them enough.
Clean , but their food is extremely flavorless ! Go to Bamboo ‼️
The food was awesome! First time eating Jamaican food. The staff was also friendly and helpful. Highly recommended!!

name: Hong Kong Restaurant
address: 164 Hamilton Ave, Trenton, NJ 08609, USA
reviews: House special rice 😋! Fried plantain made fresh-

I have never had a bad experience with this restaurant.  The young lady on the phone is always pleasant and kind. My food is always hot and I am always satisfied with the service.Clean when I step inside of the place which is very great.
Always amazing dining experience here. Their prices are the best and the food is well cooked. Recommended!

The food was well priced and adequate in taste.  The steamed dumplings tasted fine but were a bit doughy.  It's not a bad place for take out, food was ready pretty quickly.  Bottom line is you get what you pay for.

The fried chicken was dry, hard, and unseasoned. The eggrolls were grease logged, and their shrimp was enveloped in a soggy breading. The rice was over cooked. The food is poorly seasoned and has no flavor. I'm not fond of the customer service either. Laughing at customers makes you and your food look suspect. name: Jerry's Pizza

reviews: Great food. Placed is closed due to fire. Miss this place.

Best Salads Ever. The chicken is so good. The Apple Cider Dressins is delicious and the rolls that come with it are hard not to eat!!
Your phone number is incorrect !! Tried calling several times from work 💔 we order from you guys all the time but we’ve been having issues now. Please fix we love you!

name: Casablanca Restaurant

reviews: Didn't feel very welcomed as a non-spanish speaking patron. Food took a long time (30+ min). Was delicious when came out but this is more of an order and pick up spot unless you are one of the locals/regulars.

It has a nice atmosphere, the fo iui d is good, and the ppl r very nice!!!

name: Two Flags - Restaurant

reviews: Best place to have dinner.

Great Ecuadorian Cuisine and i have been eating here for 5 years minimum. I still would recommend this to anyone i know. Language barrier is pretty heavy and they have hung up on me when i tried speaking English to them. The only time i get them on the phone is when i call and speak Spanish.

Love the food , very clean place and the prices are great.   
Definitely recommend it. 
You can pick up your food , eat in and they do delivery as well. 
So overall to me 5 starts.  Love it.  
Check them out and see for yourself.
Good Hispanic & American foods,cold and hot beverages, Great service and good food
The food is very good and the place is clean and they know how to treat you

name: Mr. Wok
address: 1250 S Broad St, Trenton, NJ 08610, USA
reviews: This place has horrible service. I ordered my food at 7pm and they never showed up so at 9pm I called them and told them in canceling my order they tell me my food will be here in 5 mins. This is the place to get your fresh. Delicious. Chinese Food. Take out or pick up. And is a friendly environment.😌
Good fast clean place to eat at reasonable prices.

name: Guatelinda
address: 1234 S Clinton Ave, Trenton, NJ 08611, USA
reviews: Where do I start .. I will say , the food has good flavor and the service is ok. I've been here 3 times already and twice my food came out cold ,.. Guatelinda is quite simply, one of the best places to get affordable, delicious, Guatemalan style food. But before I get into this, let me explain the menu a little bit.

If you look at the menu and really think about it, most of Guatelinda's menu is a remix of the same ingredients. Do you want pork, chicken, and steak? Or do you just want steak? Or do you want steak with plantains? Or do you want pork with steak and plantains? Or Do you want steak and shrimp?

That's pretty much the gist of it. Along with the chicken, steak, and pork combos you can get tacos, tostadas, breakfast menu items, and a few other selections that I can't remember off the top of my head.

The point is, the food is extremely delicious and flavorful, though some with a sensitive palate might think it's salty. Every item has its own distinct taste and compliments the 5 star quality rice and beans sides. In fact, some people, like my mother, only eat at Guatelinda to enjoy their rice and beans. Crazy!

The drink selection is full of Latino favorites. You can order a pineapple mango drink, horchata drink, or choose from a selection of Mexican sodas called Jarritas.

The portions are enormous, so do not come here if you're not hungry. You absolutely need to bring an appetite because you are going to be well-fed with just one entrée. And with how inexpensive the menu items are, you are going to be tempted to order a lot of food. I don't recommend this unless you're planning to take it home.

If I have anything to nitpick about Guatelinda, it has to be the parking. Rarely is there a parking spot in front of the restaurant and often you're forced to pull into a driveway that will scrape the bumper of any low riding cars. The traffic and drivers in this part of the neighborhood are reckless and obnoxious so be careful if you're going to dine in.

They do offer take out and they do deliver, so certainly make sure to use those options if dealing with terrible drivers is not for you.

If I'm hungry, on a budget, and want good Spanish food, Guatelinda will be first on my list to call.

name: Halal Brothers

reviews: [Covid-19 time period] One of the best take out experiences we've had during the pandemic. Food and service were impeccable. Also amazing was the hummus.  We love (and occasionally make our own) hummus and this was better than we can remember ever having.  We'll be back soon and often.
